AssetBundleImportJobVPCConnectionOverrid.documentation: An object that contains a list of tags to be assigned to a list of VPC connection IDs.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the resource that the warning occurred for.

Message.documentation: A description of the warning that occurred during an Asset Bundle import job.

AssetBundleImportJobWarning.documentation: Describes a warning that occurred during an Asset Bundle import job.

Body.documentation:
The bytes of the base64 encoded asset bundle import zip file. This file can't exceed 20 MB. If the size of the file that you want to upload is more than 20 MB, add the file to your Amazon S3 bucket and use S3Uri of the file for this operation.

If you are calling the API operations from the Amazon Web Services SDK for Java, JavaScript, Python, or PHP, the SDK encodes base64 automatically to allow the direct setting of the zip file's bytes. If you are using an SDK for a different language or receiving related errors, try to base64 encode your data.

S3Uri.documentation: The Amazon S3 URI for an asset bundle import file that exists in an Amazon S3 bucket that the caller has read access to. The file must be a zip format file and can't exceed 1 GB.

AssetBundleImportSource.documentation: The source of the asset bundle zip file that contains the data that you want to import. The file must be in QUICKSIGHT_JSON format.

Body.documentation: An HTTPS download URL for the provided asset bundle that you optionally provided at the start of the import job. This URL is valid for five minutes after issuance. Call DescribeAssetBundleExportJob again for a fresh URL if needed. The downloaded asset bundle is a .qs zip file.

S3Uri.documentation: The Amazon S3 URI that you provided at the start of the import job.

AssetBundleImportSourceDescription.documentation: A description of the import source that you provide at the start of an import job. This value is set to either Body or S3Uri, depending on how the StartAssetBundleImportJobRequest is configured.

Permissions.documentation: A list of link sharing permissions for the dashboards that you want to apply overrides to.

AssetBundleResourceLinkSharingConfigurat.documentation: A structure that contains the configuration of a shared link to an QuickSight dashboard.

Principals.documentation: A list of principals to grant permissions on.

Actions.documentation: A list of IAM actions to grant permissions on.

AssetBundleResourcePermissions.documentation: A structure that contains the permissions for the resource that you want to override in an asset bundle import job.

WeekStart.documentation: Determines the week start day for an analysis.

QBusinessInsightsStatus.documentation: Determines whether insight summaries from Amazon Q Business are allowed in Dashboard Q&A.

ExcludedDataSetArns.documentation: A list of dataset ARNS to exclude from Dashboard Q&A.

CustomActionDefaults.documentation: A list of visual custom actions for the analysis.

RoleArn.documentation: Use the RoleArn structure to override an account-wide role for a specific Athena data source. For example, say an account administrator has turned off all Athena access with an account-wide role. The administrator can then use RoleArn to bypass the account-wide role and allow Athena access for the single Athena data source that is specified in the structure, even if the account-wide role forbidding Athena access is still active.

IdentityCenterConfiguration.documentation:
An optional parameter that configures IAM Identity Center authentication to grant QuickSight access to your workgroup.

This parameter can only be specified if your QuickSight account is configured with IAM Identity Center.

SimpleAttributeAggregation.documentation:
The built-in aggregation functions for attributes.

  • UNIQUE_VALUE: Returns the unique value for a field, aggregated by the dimension fields.

ValueForMultipleValues.documentation: Used by the UNIQUE_VALUE aggregation function. If there are multiple values for the field used by the aggregation, the value for this property will be returned instead. Defaults to '*'.

Host.documentation: The Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible host to connect to.

Port.documentation: The port that Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL is listening on.

Database.documentation: The Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL database to connect to.

Service.documentation: The name of the Amazon Web Services service.

AuthorizedTargets.documentation: Aist of authorized targets that are represented by IAM Identity Center application ARNs.

AuthorizedTargetsByService.documentation: The authorized targets that are associated with a service.

NumericAxisOptions.documentation: The options for an axis with a numeric field.

DateAxisOptions.documentation: The options for an axis with a date field.

AxisDataOptions.documentation:
The data options for an axis.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

AxisDisplayDataDrivenRange.documentation: The options that are saved for future extension.

Minimum.documentation: The minimum setup for an axis display range.

Maximum.documentation: The maximum setup for an axis display range.

AxisDisplayMinMaxRange.documentation: The minimum and maximum setup for an axis display range.

TickLabelOptions.documentation: The tick label options of an axis.

AxisLineVisibility.documentation: Determines whether or not the axis line is visible.

GridLineVisibility.documentation: Determines whether or not the grid line is visible.

ScrollbarOptions.documentation: The scroll bar options for an axis.

AxisOffset.documentation: The offset value that determines the starting placement of the axis within a visual's bounds.

AxisDisplayOptions.documentation: The display options for the axis label.

MinMax.documentation: The minimum and maximum setup of an axis display range.

DataDriven.documentation: The data-driven setup of an axis display range.

AxisDisplayRange.documentation:
The range setup of a numeric axis display range.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

FontConfiguration.documentation: The font configuration of the axis label.

ApplyTo.documentation: The options that indicate which field the label belongs to.

AxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options for a chart axis. You must specify the field that the label is targeted to.

FieldId.documentation: The field that the axis label is targeted to.

Column.documentation: The column that the axis label is targeted to.

AxisLabelReferenceOptions.documentation: The reference that specifies where the axis label is applied to.

StepCount.documentation: The step count setup of a linear axis.

StepSize.documentation: The step size setup of a linear axis.

AxisLinearScale.documentation:
The liner axis scale setup.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

Base.documentation: The base setup of a logarithmic axis scale.

AxisScale.documentation:
The scale setup options for a numeric axis display.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

LabelOptions.documentation: Determines whether or not the axis ticks are visible.

RotationAngle.documentation: The rotation angle of the axis tick labels.

AxisTickLabelOptions.documentation: The tick label options of an axis.

Category.documentation: The category (y-axis) field well of a bar chart.

Values.documentation: The value field wells of a bar chart. Values are aggregated by category.

Colors.documentation: The color (group/color) field well of a bar chart.

SmallMultiples.documentation: The small multiples field well of a bar chart.

BarChartAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field wells of a bar chart.

Orientation.documentation:
The orientation of the bars in a bar chart visual. There are two valid values in this structure:

  • HORIZONTAL: Used for charts that have horizontal bars. Visuals that use this value are horizontal bar charts, horizontal stacked bar charts, and horizontal stacked 100% bar charts.

  • VERTICAL: Used for charts that have vertical bars. Visuals that use this value are vertical bar charts, vertical stacked bar charts, and vertical stacked 100% bar charts.

BarsArrangement.documentation: Determines the arrangement of the bars. The orientation and arrangement of bars determine the type of bar that is used in the visual.

VisualPalette.documentation: The palette (chart color) display setup of the visual.

SmallMultiplesOptions.documentation: The small multiples setup for the visual.

CategoryAxis.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, axis step) for bar chart category.

CategoryLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility and sort icon visibility) for a bar chart.

ValueAxis.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, axis step) for a bar chart value.

ValueLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility and sort icon visibility) for a bar chart value.

ColorLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility and sort icon visibility) for a color that is used in a bar chart.

Legend.documentation: The legend display setup of the visual.

DataLabels.documentation: The options that determine if visual data labels are displayed.

Tooltip.documentation: The tooltip display setup of the visual.

ReferenceLines.documentation: The reference line setup of the visual.

ContributionAnalysisDefaults.documentation: The contribution analysis (anomaly configuration) setup of the visual.

Interactions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for a visual.

BarChartAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field wells of a bar chart.

BarChartFieldWells.documentation:
The field wells of a BarChartVisual.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

CategoryItemsLimit.documentation: The limit on the number of categories displayed in a bar chart.

ColorSort.documentation: The sort configuration of color fields in a bar chart.

ColorItemsLimit.documentation: The limit on the number of values displayed in a bar chart.

SmallMultiplesSort.documentation: The sort configuration of the small multiples field.

SmallMultiplesLimitConfiguration.documentation: The limit on the number of small multiples panels that are displayed.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers.

Title.documentation: The title that is displayed on the visual.

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

ColumnHierarchies.documentation: The column hierarchy that is used during drill-downs and drill-ups.

BarChartVisual.documentation:
A bar chart.

The BarChartVisual structure describes a visual that is a member of the bar chart family. The following charts can be described using this structure:

  • Horizontal bar chart

  • Vertical bar chart

  • Horizontal stacked bar chart

  • Vertical stacked bar chart

  • Horizontal stacked 100% bar chart

  • Vertical stacked 100% bar chart

For more information, see Using bar charts in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to create a reviewed answer in.

TopicId.documentation: The ID for the topic reviewed answer that you want to create. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

Answers.documentation: The definition of the Answers to be created.

TopicId.documentation: The ID for the topic reviewed answer that you want to create. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

TopicArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topic.

SucceededAnswers.documentation: The definition of Answers that are successfully created.

InvalidAnswers.documentation: The definition of Answers that are invalid and not created.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to delete a reviewed answers in.

TopicId.documentation: The ID for the topic reviewed answer that you want to delete. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

AnswerIds.documentation: The Answer IDs of the Answers to be deleted.

TopicId.documentation: The ID of the topic reviewed answer that you want to delete. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

TopicArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topic.

SucceededAnswers.documentation: The definition of Answers that are successfully deleted.

InvalidAnswers.documentation: The definition of Answers that are invalid and not deleted.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

ProjectId.documentation: The Google Cloud Platform project ID where your datasource was created.

DataSetRegion.documentation: The storage location where you create a Google BigQuery data source.

BigQueryParameters.documentation: The parameters that are required to connect to a Google BigQuery data source.

Value.documentation: The options that determine the bin count value.

BinCountOptions.documentation: The options that determine the bin count of a histogram.

Value.documentation: The options that determine the bin width value.

BinCountLimit.documentation: The options that determine the bin count limit.

BinWidthOptions.documentation: The options that determine the bin width of a histogram.

SectionId.documentation: The unique identifier of a body section.

Content.documentation: The configuration of content in a body section.

Style.documentation: The style options of a body section.

PageBreakConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of a page break for a section.

RepeatConfiguration.documentation: Describes the configurations that are required to declare a section as repeating.

Layout.documentation: The layout configuration of a body section.

BodySectionContent.documentation: The configuration of content in a body section.

Limit.documentation: Number of values to use from the column for repetition.

SortByMetrics.documentation: Sort criteria on the column values that you use for repetition.

BodySectionDynamicCategoryDimensionConfi.documentation: Describes the Category dataset column and constraints for the dynamic values used to repeat the contents of a section.

Limit.documentation: Number of values to use from the column for repetition.

SortByMetrics.documentation: Sort criteria on the column values that you use for repetition.

BodySectionDynamicNumericDimensionConfig.documentation: Describes the Numeric dataset column and constraints for the dynamic values used to repeat the contents of a section.

DimensionConfigurations.documentation: List of BodySectionRepeatDimensionConfiguration values that describe the dataset column and constraints for the column used to repeat the contents of a section.

PageBreakConfiguration.documentation: Page break configuration to apply for each repeating instance.

NonRepeatingVisuals.documentation: List of visuals to exclude from repetition in repeating sections. The visuals will render identically, and ignore the repeating configurations in all repeating instances.

BodySectionRepeatConfiguration.documentation: Describes the configurations that are required to declare a section as repeating.

DynamicCategoryDimensionConfiguration.documentation: Describes the Category dataset column and constraints around the dynamic values that will be used in repeating the section contents.

DynamicNumericDimensionConfiguration.documentation: Describes the Numeric dataset column and constraints around the dynamic values used to repeat the contents of a section.

BodySectionRepeatDimensionConfiguration.documentation: Describes the dataset column and constraints for the dynamic values used to repeat the contents of a section. The dataset column is either Category or Numeric column configuration

BodySectionRepeatPageBreakConfiguration.documentation: The page break configuration to apply for each repeating instance.

Enabled.documentation: A Boolean value that determines whether a user can bookmark an embedded dashboard.

BookmarksConfigurations.documentation: The bookmarks configuration of an embedded dashboard.

Show.documentation: The option to enable display of borders for visuals.

BorderStyle.documentation: The display options for tile borders for visuals.

GroupBy.documentation: The group by field well of a box plot chart. Values are grouped based on group by fields.

Values.documentation: The value field well of a box plot chart. Values are aggregated based on group by fields.

BoxPlotAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field well for a box plot.

BoxPlotOptions.documentation: The box plot chart options for a box plot visual

CategoryAxis.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, axis step) of a box plot category.

CategoryLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility and sort Icon visibility) of a box plot category.

PrimaryYAxisDisplayOptions.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, axis step) of a box plot category.

PrimaryYAxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility and sort icon visibility) of a box plot value.

Tooltip.documentation: The tooltip display setup of the visual.

ReferenceLines.documentation: The reference line setup of the visual.

VisualPalette.documentation: The palette (chart color) display setup of the visual.

Interactions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for a visual.

BoxPlotAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field wells of a box plot.

BoxPlotFieldWells.documentation:
The field wells of a BoxPlotVisual.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

StyleOptions.documentation: The style options of the box plot.

OutlierVisibility.documentation: Determines the visibility of the outlier in a box plot.

AllDataPointsVisibility.documentation: Determines the visibility of all data points of the box plot.

BoxPlotOptions.documentation: The options of a box plot visual.

CategorySort.documentation: The sort configuration of a group by fields.

PaginationConfiguration.documentation: The pagination configuration of a table visual or box plot.

FillStyle.documentation: The fill styles (solid, transparent) of the box plot.

BoxPlotStyleOptions.documentation: The style options of the box plot.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers..

Title.documentation: The title that is displayed on the visual.

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

ColumnHierarchies.documentation: The column hierarchy that is used during drill-downs and drill-ups.

BoxPlotVisual.documentation:
A box plot.

For more information, see Using box plots in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

Accent.documentation: The color that is used for accent elements.

Measure.documentation: The color that is used for measure elements.

Dimension.documentation: The color that is used for dimension elements.

Success.documentation: The color that is used for success elements.

Info.documentation: The color that is used for info elements.

Warning.documentation: The color that is used for warning elements.

Danger.documentation: The color that is used for danger elements.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the brand.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the brand was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The last time the brand was updated.

Errors.documentation: A list of errors that occurred during the most recent brand operation.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the brand.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the brand was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the brand was last updated.

ColumnId.documentation: A unique ID to identify a calculated column. During a dataset update, if the column ID of a calculated column matches that of an existing calculated column, Amazon QuickSight preserves the existing calculated column.

Expression.documentation: An expression that defines the calculated column.

DataSetIdentifier.documentation: The data set that is used in this calculated field.

FieldId.documentation: The custom field ID.

CalculatedMeasureField.documentation: The table calculation measure field for pivot tables.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID of the dataset used in the ingestion.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the data ingestion.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

ExportToCsv.documentation: The ability to export to CSV files from the UI.

ExportToExcel.documentation: The ability to export to Excel files from the UI.

ExportToPdf.documentation: The ability to export to PDF files from the UI.

CreateAndUpdateThemes.documentation: The ability to export to Create and Update themes.

AddOrRunAnomalyDetectionForAnalyses.documentation: The ability to add or run anomaly detection.

CreateAndUpdateDatasets.documentation: The ability to create and update datasets.

SubscribeDashboardEmailReports.documentation: The ability to subscribe to email reports.

CreateAndUpdateDashboardEmailReports.documentation: The ability to create and update email reports.

CreateAndUpdateThresholdAlerts.documentation: The ability to create and update threshold alerts.

CreateAndUpdateDataSources.documentation: The ability to create and update data sources.

ViewAccountSPICECapacity.documentation: The ability to view account SPICE capacity.

CreateSPICEDataset.documentation: The ability to create a SPICE dataset.

ExportToPdfInScheduledReports.documentation: The ability to export to PDF files in scheduled email reports.

ExportToCsvInScheduledReports.documentation: The ability to export to CSV files in scheduled email reports.

ExportToExcelInScheduledReports.documentation: The ability to export to Excel files in scheduled email reports.

IncludeContentInScheduledReportsEmail.documentation: The ability to include content in scheduled email reports.

Capabilities.documentation: A set of actions that correspond to QuickSight permissions.

SourceControls.documentation: A list of source controls that determine the values that are used in the current control.

CascadingControlConfiguration.documentation: The values that are displayed in a control can be configured to only show values that are valid based on what's selected in other controls.

SourceSheetControlId.documentation: The source sheet control ID of a CascadingControlSource.

ColumnToMatch.documentation: The column identifier that determines which column to look up for the source sheet control.

CascadingControlSource.documentation: The source controls that are used in a CascadingControlConfiguration.

SubType.documentation: The sub data type of the new column. Sub types are only available for decimal columns that are part of a SPICE dataset.

Format.documentation: When casting a column from string to datetime type, you can supply a string in a format supported by Amazon QuickSight to denote the source data format.

CastColumnTypeOperation.documentation: A transform operation that casts a column to a different type.

FieldId.documentation: The custom field ID.

Column.documentation: The column that is used in the CategoricalDimensionField.

CategoricalDimensionField.documentation: The dimension type field with categorical type columns..

FieldId.documentation: The custom field ID.

Column.documentation: The column that is used in the CategoricalMeasureField.

AggregationFunction.documentation: The aggregation function of the measure field.

CategoricalMeasureField.documentation: The measure type field with categorical type columns.

Column.documentation: The column that the filter is applied to.

CategoryValues.documentation: A list of the string inputs that are the values of the category drill down filter.

FilterId.documentation: An identifier that uniquely identifies a filter within a dashboard, analysis, or template.

Column.documentation: The column that the filter is applied to.

DefaultFilterControlConfiguration.documentation: The default configurations for the associated controls. This applies only for filters that are scoped to multiple sheets.

CategoryFilter.documentation:
A CategoryFilter filters text values.

For more information, see Adding text filters in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

FilterListConfiguration.documentation: A list of filter configurations. In the QuickSight console, this filter type is called a filter list.

CustomFilterListConfiguration.documentation: A list of custom filter values. In the QuickSight console, this filter type is called a custom filter list.

CustomFilterConfiguration.documentation: A custom filter that filters based on a single value. This filter can be partially matched.

CategoryFilterConfiguration.documentation:
The configuration for a CategoryFilter.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

Synonyms.documentation: Other names or aliases for the cell value.

CellValueSynonym.documentation: A structure that represents the cell value synonym.

Visibility.documentation:
The visibility of an axis label on a chart. Choose one of the following options:

  • VISIBLE: Shows the axis.

  • HIDDEN: Hides the axis.

SortIconVisibility.documentation: The visibility configuration of the sort icon on a chart's axis label.

AxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options for a chart axis.

ChartAxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options for an axis on a chart.

SimpleClusterMarker.documentation: The simple cluster marker of the cluster marker.

ClusterMarker.documentation: The cluster marker that is a part of the cluster marker configuration.
The cluster marker that is a part of the cluster marker configuration.

ClusterMarkerConfiguration.documentation: The cluster marker configuration of the geospatial map selected point style.

ValueList.documentation: A list of values for the collective constant.

CollectiveConstant.documentation: A structure that represents a collective constant.

Value.documentation: The value of a CollectiveConstantEntry.

Colors.documentation: Determines the list of colors that are applied to the visual.

NullValueColor.documentation: Determines the color that is applied to null values.

ColorScale.documentation: Determines the color scale that is applied to the visual.

CustomColors.documentation: A list of up to 50 custom colors.

Column.documentation: The column.

Text.documentation: The text of a description for a column.

ColumnDescription.documentation: Metadata that contains a description for a column.

GeoSpatialColumnGroup.documentation: Geospatial column group that denotes a hierarchy.

ColumnGroup.documentation: Groupings of columns that work together in certain Amazon QuickSight features. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

Name.documentation: The name of the column group's column schema.

ColumnGroupColumnSchema.documentation: A structure describing the name, data type, and geographic role of the columns.

Name.documentation: The name of the column group schema.

ColumnGroupColumnSchemaList.documentation: A structure containing the list of schemas for column group columns.

ExplicitHierarchy.documentation: The option that determines the hierarchy of the fields that are built within a visual's field wells. These fields can't be duplicated to other visuals.

DateTimeHierarchy.documentation: The option that determines the hierarchy of any DateTime fields.

PredefinedHierarchy.documentation: The option that determines the hierarchy of the fields that are defined during data preparation. These fields are available to use in any analysis that uses the data source.

ColumnHierarchy.documentation: The option that determines the hierarchy of the fields for a visual element.

DataSetIdentifier.documentation: The data set that the column belongs to.

Principals.documentation: An array of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for QuickSight users or groups.

ColumnLevelPermissionRule.documentation: A rule defined to grant access on one or more restricted columns. Each dataset can have multiple rules. To create a restricted column, you add it to one or more rules. Each rule must contain at least one column and at least one user or group. To be able to see a restricted column, a user or group needs to be added to a rule for that column.

DataType.documentation: The data type of the column schema.

GeographicRole.documentation: The geographic role of the column schema.

AggregationFunction.documentation: The aggregation function that is defined in the column sort.

ColumnSort.documentation: The sort configuration for a column that is not used in a field well.

ColumnTag.documentation: A tag for a column in a TagColumnOperation structure. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

Column.documentation: The target column of the tooltip item.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the tooltip item.

Aggregation.documentation: The aggregation function of the column tooltip item.

TooltipTarget.documentation: Determines the target of the column tooltip item in a combo chart visual.

ColumnTooltipItem.documentation: The tooltip item for the columns that are not part of a field well.

Category.documentation: The aggregated category field wells of a combo chart.

BarValues.documentation: The aggregated BarValues field well of a combo chart.

Colors.documentation: The aggregated colors field well of a combo chart.

LineValues.documentation: The aggregated LineValues field well of a combo chart.

ComboChartAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field wells of a combo chart.

BarsArrangement.documentation:
Determines the bar arrangement in a combo chart. The following are valid values in this structure:

  • CLUSTERED: For clustered bar combo charts.

  • STACKED: For stacked bar combo charts.

  • STACKED_PERCENT: Do not use. If you use this value, the operation returns a validation error.

CategoryAxis.documentation: The category axis of a combo chart.

CategoryLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility, and sort icon visibility) of a combo chart category (group/color) field well.

PrimaryYAxisDisplayOptions.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, and axis step) of a combo chart's primary y-axis (bar) field well.

PrimaryYAxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility, and sort icon visibility) of a combo chart's primary y-axis (bar) field well.

SecondaryYAxisDisplayOptions.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, axis step) of a combo chart's secondary y-axis (line) field well.

SecondaryYAxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility, and sort icon visibility) of a combo chart's secondary y-axis(line) field well.

ColorLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility, and sort icon visibility) of a combo chart's color field well.

Legend.documentation: The legend display setup of the visual.

BarDataLabels.documentation:
The options that determine if visual data labels are displayed.

The data label options for a bar in a combo chart.

LineDataLabels.documentation:
The options that determine if visual data labels are displayed.

The data label options for a line in a combo chart.

Tooltip.documentation: The legend display setup of the visual.

ReferenceLines.documentation: The reference line setup of the visual.

VisualPalette.documentation: The palette (chart color) display setup of the visual.

Interactions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for a visual.

ComboChartAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field wells of a combo chart. Combo charts only have aggregated field wells. Columns in a combo chart are aggregated by category.

ComboChartFieldWells.documentation:
The field wells of the visual.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

CategorySort.documentation: The sort configuration of the category field well in a combo chart.

CategoryItemsLimit.documentation: The item limit configuration for the category field well of a combo chart.

ColorSort.documentation: The sort configuration of the color field well in a combo chart.

ColorItemsLimit.documentation: The item limit configuration of the color field well in a combo chart.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers.

Title.documentation: The title that is displayed on the visual.

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

ColumnHierarchies.documentation: The column hierarchy that is used during drill-downs and drill-ups.

ComboChartVisual.documentation:
A combo chart.

The ComboChartVisual includes stacked bar combo charts and clustered bar combo charts

For more information, see Using combo charts in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

UseOrdering.documentation: The ordering type for a column. Valid values for this structure are GREATER_IS_BETTER, LESSER_IS_BETTER and SPECIFIED.

SpecifedOrder.documentation: The list of columns to be used in the ordering.

TreatUndefinedSpecifiedValues.documentation: The treat of undefined specified values. Valid values for this structure are LEAST and MOST.

ComparativeOrder.documentation: A structure that represents a comparative order.

ComparisonMethod.documentation:
The method of the comparison. Choose from the following options:

  • DIFFERENCE

  • PERCENT_DIFFERENCE

  • PERCENT

ComparisonConfiguration.documentation: The comparison display configuration of a KPI or gauge chart.

ComparisonFormatConfiguration.documentation:
The format of the comparison.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

TopBottomRanked.documentation: The top ranked and bottom ranked computation configuration.

TopBottomMovers.documentation: The top movers and bottom movers computation configuration.

Computation.documentation:
The computation union that is used in an insight visual.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

ConcurrentUpdatingException.documentation: A resource is already in a state that indicates an operation is happening that must complete before a new update can be applied.

Expression.documentation: The expression that determines the condition of the icon set.

IconOptions.documentation: Custom icon options for an icon set.

ConditionalFormattingCustomIconCondition.documentation: Determines the custom condition for an icon set.

ConditionalFormattingCustomIconOptions.documentation: Custom icon options for an icon set.

Expression.documentation: The expression that determines the formatting configuration for gradient color.

CustomCondition.documentation: Determines the custom condition for an icon set.

Expression.documentation: The expression that determines the formatting configuration for the icon set.
The expression that determines the formatting configuration for solid color.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

ConflictException.documentation: Updating or deleting a resource can cause an inconsistent state.

AvailabilityStatus.documentation: The availability status of the context menu options. If the value of this property is set to ENABLED, dashboard readers can interact with the context menu.

ContextMenuOption.documentation: The context menu options for a visual's interactions.

MeasureFieldId.documentation: The measure field that is used in the contribution analysis.

ContributorDimensions.documentation: The dimensions columns that are used in the contribution analysis, usually a list of ColumnIdentifiers.

ContributionAnalysisDefault.documentation: The contribution analysis visual display for a line, pie, or bar chart.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that you want to customize QuickSight for.

Namespace.documentation: The QuickSight namespace that you want to add customizations to.

AccountCustomization.documentation:
The QuickSight customizations you're adding in the current Amazon Web Services Region. You can add these to an Amazon Web Services account and a QuickSight namespace.

For example, you can add a default theme by setting AccountCustomization to the midnight theme: "AccountCustomization": { "DefaultTheme": "arn:aws:quicksight::aws:theme/MIDNIGHT" }. Or, you can add a custom theme by specifying "AccountCustomization": { "DefaultTheme": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-west-2:111122223333:theme/bdb844d0-0fe9-4d9d-b520-0fe602d93639" }.

Tags.documentation: A list of the tags that you want to attach to this resource.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the customization that you created for this Amazon Web Services account.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that you want to customize QuickSight for.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace associated with the customization you're creating.

AccountCustomization.documentation: The QuickSight customizations you're adding in the current Amazon Web Services Region.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

Edition.documentation:
The edition of QuickSight that you want your account to have. Currently, you can choose from ENTERPRISE or ENTERPRISE_AND_Q.

If you choose ENTERPRISE_AND_Q, the following parameters are required:

  • FirstName

  • LastName

  • EmailAddress

  • ContactNumber

AuthenticationMethod.documentation:
The method that you want to use to authenticate your QuickSight account.

If you choose ACTIVE_DIRECTORY, provide an ActiveDirectoryName and an AdminGroup associated with your Active Directory.

If you choose IAM_IDENTITY_CENTER, provide an AdminGroup associated with your IAM Identity Center account.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the account that you're using to create your QuickSight account.

AccountName.documentation: The name of your QuickSight account. This name is unique over all of Amazon Web Services, and it appears only when users sign in. You can't change AccountName value after the QuickSight account is created.

NotificationEmail.documentation: The email address that you want QuickSight to send notifications to regarding your QuickSight account or QuickSight subscription.

ActiveDirectoryName.documentation: The name of your Active Directory. This field is required if ACTIVE_DIRECTORY is the selected authentication method of the new QuickSight account.

Realm.documentation: The realm of the Active Directory that is associated with your QuickSight account. This field is required if ACTIVE_DIRECTORY is the selected authentication method of the new QuickSight account.

DirectoryId.documentation: The ID of the Active Directory that is associated with your QuickSight account.

AdminGroup.documentation:
The admin group associated with your Active Directory or IAM Identity Center account. Either this field or the AdminProGroup field is required if ACTIVE_DIRECTORY or IAM_IDENTITY_CENTER is the selected authentication method of the new QuickSight account.

For more information about using IAM Identity Center in QuickSight, see Using IAM Identity Center with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide. For more information about using Active Directory in QuickSight, see Using Active Directory with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide.

AuthorGroup.documentation:
The author group associated with your Active Directory or IAM Identity Center account.

For more information about using IAM Identity Center in QuickSight, see Using IAM Identity Center with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide. For more information about using Active Directory in QuickSight, see Using Active Directory with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide.

ReaderGroup.documentation:
The reader group associated with your Active Directory or IAM Identity Center account.

For more information about using IAM Identity Center in QuickSight, see Using IAM Identity Center with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide. For more information about using Active Directory in QuickSight, see Using Active Directory with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide.

AdminProGroup.documentation:
The admin pro group associated with your Active Directory or IAM Identity Center account. Either this field or the AdminGroup field is required if ACTIVE_DIRECTORY or IAM_IDENTITY_CENTER is the selected authentication method of the new QuickSight account.

For more information about using IAM Identity Center in QuickSight, see Using IAM Identity Center with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide. For more information about using Active Directory in QuickSight, see Using Active Directory with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide.

AuthorProGroup.documentation:
The author pro group associated with your Active Directory or IAM Identity Center account.

For more information about using IAM Identity Center in QuickSight, see Using IAM Identity Center with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide. For more information about using Active Directory in QuickSight, see Using Active Directory with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide.

ReaderProGroup.documentation:
The reader pro group associated with your Active Directory or IAM Identity Center account.

For more information about using IAM Identity Center in QuickSight, see Using IAM Identity Center with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide. For more information about using Active Directory in QuickSight, see Using Active Directory with QuickSight Enterprise Edition in the QuickSight User Guide.

FirstName.documentation: The first name of the author of the QuickSight account to use for future communications. This field is required if ENTERPPRISE_AND_Q is the selected edition of the new QuickSight account.

LastName.documentation: The last name of the author of the QuickSight account to use for future communications. This field is required if ENTERPPRISE_AND_Q is the selected edition of the new QuickSight account.

EmailAddress.documentation: The email address of the author of the QuickSight account to use for future communications. This field is required if ENTERPPRISE_AND_Q is the selected edition of the new QuickSight account.

ContactNumber.documentation: A 10-digit phone number for the author of the QuickSight account to use for future communications. This field is required if ENTERPPRISE_AND_Q is the selected edition of the new QuickSight account.

IAMIdentityCenterInstanceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM Identity Center instance.

SignupResponse.documentation: A SignupResponse object that returns information about a newly created QuickSight account.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account where you are creating an analysis.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID for the analysis that you're creating. This ID displays in the URL of the analysis.

Name.documentation: A descriptive name for the analysis that you're creating. This name displays for the analysis in the QuickSight console.

Parameters.documentation: The parameter names and override values that you want to use. An analysis can have any parameter type, and some parameters might accept multiple values.

Permissions.documentation:
A structure that describes the principals and the resource-level permissions on an analysis. You can use the Permissions structure to grant permissions by providing a list of Identity and Access Management (IAM) action information for each principal listed by Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

To specify no permissions, omit Permissions.

SourceEntity.documentation:
A source entity to use for the analysis that you're creating. This metadata structure contains details that describe a source template and one or more datasets.

Either a SourceEntity or a Definition must be provided in order for the request to be valid.

ThemeArn.documentation: The ARN for the theme to apply to the analysis that you're creating. To see the theme in the QuickSight console, make sure that you have access to it.

Tags.documentation: Contains a map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the analysis.

Definition.documentation:
The definition of an analysis.

A definition is the data model of all features in a Dashboard, Template, or Analysis.

Either a SourceEntity or a Definition must be provided in order for the request to be valid.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: The option to relax the validation needed to create an analysis with definition objects. This skips the validation step for specific errors.

FolderArns.documentation: When you create the analysis, QuickSight adds the analysis to these folders.

Arn.documentation: The ARN for the analysis.

CreationStatus.documentation: The status of the creation of the analysis.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the brand.

Tags.documentation: A map of the key-value pairs that are assigned to the brand.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

CreateColumnsOperation.documentation: A transform operation that creates calculated columns. Columns created in one such operation form a lexical closure.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to create the custom permissions profile in.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation: The name of the custom permissions profile that you want to create.

Capabilities.documentation: A set of actions to include in the custom permissions profile.

Tags.documentation: The tags to associate with the custom permissions profile.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom permissions profile.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account where you want to create the dashboard.

DashboardId.documentation: The ID for the dashboard, also added to the IAM policy.

Parameters.documentation: The parameters for the creation of the dashboard, which you want to use to override the default settings. A dashboard can have any type of parameters, and some parameters might accept multiple values.

Permissions.documentation:
A structure that contains the permissions of the dashboard. You can use this structure for granting permissions by providing a list of IAM action information for each principal ARN.

To specify no permissions, omit the permissions list.

SourceEntity.documentation:
The entity that you are using as a source when you create the dashboard. In SourceEntity, you specify the type of object you're using as source. You can only create a dashboard from a template, so you use a SourceTemplate entity. If you need to create a dashboard from an analysis, first convert the analysis to a template by using the CreateTemplate API operation. For SourceTemplate, specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source template. The SourceTemplateARN can contain any Amazon Web Services account and any QuickSight-supported Amazon Web Services Region.

Use the DataSetReferences entity within SourceTemplate to list the replacement datasets for the placeholders listed in the original. The schema in each dataset must match its placeholder.

Either a SourceEntity or a Definition must be provided in order for the request to be valid.

Tags.documentation: Contains a map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the dashboard.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description for the first version of the dashboard being created.

DashboardPublishOptions.documentation:
Options for publishing the dashboard when you create it:

  • AvailabilityStatus for AdHocFilteringOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. When this is set to DISABLED, QuickSight disables the left filter pane on the published dashboard, which can be used for ad hoc (one-time) filtering. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • AvailabilityStatus for ExportToCSVOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. The visual option to export data to .CSV format isn't enabled when this is set to DISABLED. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • VisibilityState for SheetControlsOption - This visibility state can be either COLLAPSED or EXPANDED. This option is COLLAPSED by default.

  • AvailabilityStatus for ExecutiveSummaryOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. The option to build an executive summary is disabled when this is set to DISABLED. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • AvailabilityStatus for DataStoriesSharingOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. The option to share a data story is disabled when this is set to DISABLED. This option is ENABLED by default.

ThemeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme that is being used for this dashboard. If you add a value for this field, it overrides the value that is used in the source entity. The theme ARN must exist in the same Amazon Web Services account where you create the dashboard.

Definition.documentation:
The definition of a dashboard.

A definition is the data model of all features in a Dashboard, Template, or Analysis.

Either a SourceEntity or a Definition must be provided in order for the request to be valid.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: The option to relax the validation needed to create a dashboard with definition objects. This option skips the validation step for specific errors.

FolderArns.documentation: When you create the dashboard, QuickSight adds the dashboard to these folders.

LinkSharingConfiguration.documentation: A structure that contains the permissions of a shareable link to the dashboard.

LinkEntities.documentation: A list of analysis Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to be linked to the dashboard.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the dashboard.

VersionArn.documentation: The ARN of the dashboard, including the version number of the first version that is created.

CreationStatus.documentation: The status of the dashboard creation request.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

DataSetId.documentation: An ID for the dataset that you want to create. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

PhysicalTableMap.documentation: Declares the physical tables that are available in the underlying data sources.

LogicalTableMap.documentation: Configures the combination and transformation of the data from the physical tables.

ImportMode.documentation: Indicates whether you want to import the data into SPICE.

ColumnGroups.documentation: Groupings of columns that work together in certain QuickSight features. Currently, only geospatial hierarchy is supported.

FieldFolders.documentation: The folder that contains fields and nested subfolders for your dataset.

Permissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions on the dataset.

RowLevelPermissionDataSet.documentation: The row-level security configuration for the data that you want to create.

RowLevelPermissionTagConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of tags on a dataset to set row-level security. Row-level security tags are currently supported for anonymous embedding only.

ColumnLevelPermissionRules.documentation: A set of one or more definitions of a ColumnLevelPermissionRule .

Tags.documentation: Contains a map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the dataset.

FolderArns.documentation: When you create the dataset, QuickSight adds the dataset to these folders.

PerformanceConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for the performance optimization of the dataset that contains a UniqueKey configuration.

UseAs.documentation: The usage of the dataset. RLS_RULES must be specified for RLS permission datasets.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID for the dataset that you want to create. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

IngestionArn.documentation: The ARN for the ingestion, which is triggered as a result of dataset creation if the import mode is SPICE.

IngestionId.documentation: The ID of the ingestion, which is triggered as a result of dataset creation if the import mode is SPICE.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

DataSourceId.documentation: An ID for the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

Name.documentation: A display name for the data source.

Type.documentation:
The type of the data source. To return a list of all data sources, use ListDataSources.

Use AMAZON_ELASTICSEARCH for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

DataSourceParameters.documentation: The parameters that QuickSight uses to connect to your underlying source.

Credentials.documentation: The credentials QuickSight that uses to connect to your underlying source. Currently, only credentials based on user name and password are supported.

Permissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions on the data source.

VpcConnectionProperties.documentation: Use this parameter only when you want QuickSight to use a VPC connection when connecting to your underlying source.

SslProperties.documentation: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) properties that apply when QuickSight connects to your underlying source.

Tags.documentation: Contains a map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the data source.

FolderArns.documentation: When you create the data source, QuickSight adds the data source to these folders.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data source.

DataSourceId.documentation: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

CreationStatus.documentation: The status of creating the data source.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains the folder.

MemberId.documentation: The ID of the asset that you want to add to the folder.

MemberType.documentation: The member type of the asset that you want to add to a folder.

FolderMember.documentation: Information about the member in the folder.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account where you want to create the folder.

FolderType.documentation: The type of folder. By default, folderType is SHARED.

ParentFolderArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the parent folder.

ParentFolderArn can be null. An empty parentFolderArn creates a root-level folder.

Permissions.documentation:
A structure that describes the principals and the resource-level permissions of a folder.

To specify no permissions, omit Permissions.

Tags.documentation: Tags for the folder.

SharingModel.documentation: An optional parameter that determines the sharing scope of the folder. The default value for this parameter is ACCOUNT.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the newly created folder.

FolderId.documentation: The folder ID for the newly created folder.

RequestId.documentation: The request ID for the newly created folder.

MemberName.documentation: The name of the user that you want to add to the group membership.

GroupName.documentation: The name of the group that you want to add the user to.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the group is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that you want the user to be a part of.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

GroupName.documentation: A name for the group that you want to create.

Description.documentation: A description for the group that you want to create.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the group is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that you want the group to be a part of.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account where you want to assign an IAM policy to QuickSight users or groups.

AssignmentName.documentation: The name of the assignment, also called a rule. The name must be unique within the Amazon Web Services account.

AssignmentStatus.documentation:
The status of the assignment. Possible values are as follows:

  • ENABLED - Anything specified in this assignment is used when creating the data source.

  • DISABLED - This assignment isn't used when creating the data source.

  • DRAFT - This assignment is an unfinished draft and isn't used when creating the data source.

PolicyArn.documentation: The ARN for the IAM policy to apply to the QuickSight users and groups specified in this assignment.

Identities.documentation: The QuickSight users, groups, or both that you want to assign the policy to.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that contains the assignment.

AssignmentName.documentation: The name of the assignment. The name must be unique within the Amazon Web Services account.

AssignmentStatus.documentation:
The status of the assignment. Possible values are as follows:

  • ENABLED - Anything specified in this assignment is used when creating the data source.

  • DISABLED - This assignment isn't used when creating the data source.

  • DRAFT - This assignment is an unfinished draft and isn't used when creating the data source.

PolicyArn.documentation: The ARN for the IAM policy that is applied to the QuickSight users and groups specified in this assignment.

Identities.documentation: The QuickSight users, groups, or both that the IAM policy is assigned to.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that you want to create the QuickSight namespace in.

Namespace.documentation: The name that you want to use to describe the new namespace.

IdentityStore.documentation: Specifies the type of your user identity directory. Currently, this supports users with an identity type of QUICKSIGHT.

Tags.documentation: The tags that you want to associate with the namespace that you're creating.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the QuickSight namespace you created.

Name.documentation: The name of the new namespace that you created.

CapacityRegion.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region; that you want to use for the free SPICE capacity for the new namespace. This is set to the region that you run CreateNamespace in.

CreationStatus.documentation: The status of the creation of the namespace. This is an asynchronous process. A status of CREATED means that your namespace is ready to use. If an error occurs, it indicates if the process is retryable or non-retryable. In the case of a non-retryable error, refer to the error message for follow-up tasks.

IdentityStore.documentation: Specifies the type of your user identity directory. Currently, this supports users with an identity type of QUICKSIGHT.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

MemberName.documentation: The name of the group that you want to add to the role.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that you want to create a group in. The Amazon Web Services account ID that you provide must be the same Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that the role belongs to.

Role.documentation: The role that you want to add a group to.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the template that you creating an alias for.

AliasName.documentation: The name that you want to give to the template alias that you're creating. Don't start the alias name with the $ character. Alias names that start with $ are reserved by QuickSight.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the group is in. You use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

TemplateId.documentation: An ID for the template that you want to create. This template is unique per Amazon Web Services Region; in each Amazon Web Services account.

Permissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be set on the template.

SourceEntity.documentation:
The entity that you are using as a source when you create the template. In SourceEntity, you specify the type of object you're using as source: SourceTemplate for a template or SourceAnalysis for an analysis. Both of these require an Amazon Resource Name (ARN). For SourceTemplate, specify the ARN of the source template. For SourceAnalysis, specify the ARN of the source analysis. The SourceTemplate ARN can contain any Amazon Web Services account and any QuickSight-supported Amazon Web Services Region.

Use the DataSetReferences entity within SourceTemplate or SourceAnalysis to list the replacement datasets for the placeholders listed in the original. The schema in each dataset must match its placeholder.

Either a SourceEntity or a Definition must be provided in order for the request to be valid.

Tags.documentation: Contains a map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the resource.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description of the current template version being created. This API operation creates the first version of the template. Every time UpdateTemplate is called, a new version is created. Each version of the template maintains a description of the version in the VersionDescription field.

Definition.documentation:
The definition of a template.

A definition is the data model of all features in a Dashboard, Template, or Analysis.

Either a SourceEntity or a Definition must be provided in order for the request to be valid.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: TThe option to relax the validation needed to create a template with definition objects. This skips the validation step for specific errors.

Arn.documentation: The ARN for the template.

VersionArn.documentation: The ARN for the template, including the version information of the first version.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the theme for the new theme alias.

AliasName.documentation: The name that you want to give to the theme alias that you are creating. The alias name can't begin with a $. Alias names that start with $ are reserved by Amazon QuickSight.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account where you want to store the new theme.

ThemeId.documentation: An ID for the theme that you want to create. The theme ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region in each Amazon Web Services account.

BaseThemeId.documentation: The ID of the theme that a custom theme will inherit from. All themes inherit from one of the starting themes defined by Amazon QuickSight. For a list of the starting themes, use ListThemes or choose Themes from within an analysis.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description of the first version of the theme that you're creating. Every time UpdateTheme is called, a new version is created. Each version of the theme has a description of the version in the VersionDescription field.

Configuration.documentation: The theme configuration, which contains the theme display properties.

Permissions.documentation: A valid grouping of resource permissions to apply to the new theme.

VersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the new theme.

AlternateDataSourceParameters.documentation: A set of alternate data source parameters that you want to share for these credentials. The credentials are applied in tandem with the data source parameters when you copy a data source by using a create or update request. The API operation compares the DataSourceParameters structure that's in the request with the structures in the AlternateDataSourceParameters allow list. If the structures are an exact match, the request is allowed to use the new data source with the existing credentials. If the AlternateDataSourceParameters list is null, the DataSourceParameters originally used with these Credentials is automatically allowed.

CredentialPair.documentation: The combination of user name and password that are used as credentials.

Valid values are defined as follows:

  • NEW_TAB: Opens the target URL in a new browser tab.

  • NEW_WINDOW: Opens the target URL in a new browser window.

This option determines how null values should be treated when filtering data.

  • NULLS_ONLY: Only include null values in filtered results.

  • NON_NULLS_ONLY: Exclude null values from filtered results.

VisualPublishOptions.deprecatedMessage: VisualPublishOptions property will reach its end of standard support in a future release. To perform this action, use ExportWithHiddenFields.

DataQAEnabledOption.documentation: Adds Q&A capabilities to an QuickSight dashboard. If no topic is linked, Dashboard Q&A uses the data values that are rendered on the dashboard. End users can use Dashboard Q&A to ask for different slices of the data that they see on the dashboard. If a topic is linked, Topic Q&A is used.

Operator.documentation:
The comparison operator that you want to use as a filter, for example "Operator": "StringEquals". Valid values are "StringEquals" and "StringLike".

If you set the operator value to "StringEquals", you need to provide an ownership related filter in the "NAME" field and the arn of the user or group whose folders you want to search in the "Value" field. For example, "Name":"DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_OWNER", "Operator": "StringEquals", "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:user/default/UserName1".

If you set the value to "StringLike", you need to provide the name of the folders you are searching for. For example, "Name":"DASHBOARD_NAME", "Operator": "StringLike", "Value": "Test". The "StringLike" operator only supports the NAME value DASHBOARD_NAME.

Name.documentation:
The name of the value that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Name": "QUICKSIGHT_OWNER".

Valid values are defined as follows:

  • QUICKSIGHT_VIEWER_OR_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any dashboards with that ARN listed as one of the dashboards's owners or viewers are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are considered.

  • QUICKSIGHT_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any dashboards with that ARN listed as one of the owners of the dashboards are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are considered.

  • DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_SOLE_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any dashboards with that ARN listed as the only owner of the dashboard are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are not considered.

  • DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any dashboards with that ARN listed as one of the owners of the dashboards are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are not considered.

  • DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_VIEWER_OR_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any dashboards with that ARN listed as one of the owners or viewers of the dashboards are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are not considered.

  • DASHBOARD_NAME: Any dashboards whose names have a substring match to this value will be returned.

Value.documentation: The value of the named item, in this case QUICKSIGHT_USER, that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:user/default/UserName1".

DashboardSearchFilter.documentation: A filter that you apply when searching for dashboards.

Sheets.documentation: An array of sheet definitions for a dashboard.

The parameter declarations for a dashboard. Parameters are named variables that can transfer a value for use by an action or an object.

For more information, see Parameters in Amazon QuickSight in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

The filter definitions for a dashboard.

For more information, see Filtering Data in Amazon QuickSight in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

DashboardId.documentation: The ID of the dashboard that has the visual that you want to embed. The DashboardId can be found in the IDs for developers section of the Embed visual pane of the visual's on-visual menu of the QuickSight console. You can also get the DashboardId with a ListDashboards API operation.

SheetId.documentation: The ID of the sheet that the has visual that you want to embed. The SheetId can be found in the IDs for developers section of the Embed visual pane of the visual's on-visual menu of the QuickSight console.

DashboardVisualId.documentation:
A structure that contains the following elements:

  • The DashboardId of the dashboard that has the visual that you want to embed.

  • The SheetId of the sheet that has the visual that you want to embed.

  • The VisualId of the visual that you want to embed.

The DashboardId, SheetId, and VisualId can be found in the IDs for developers section of the Embed visual pane of the visual's on-visual menu of the QuickSight console. You can also get the DashboardId with a ListDashboards API operation.

PivotTableDataPathType.documentation:
The type of data path value utilized in a pivot table. Choose one of the following options:

  • HIERARCHY_ROWS_LAYOUT_COLUMN - The type of data path for the rows layout column, when RowsLayout is set to HIERARCHY.

  • MULTIPLE_ROW_METRICS_COLUMN - The type of data path for the metric column when the row is set to Metric Placement.

  • EMPTY_COLUMN_HEADER - The type of data path for the column with empty column header, when there is no field in ColumnsFieldWell and the row is set to Metric Placement.

  • COUNT_METRIC_COLUMN - The type of data path for the column with COUNT as the metric, when there is no field in the ValuesFieldWell.

ColumnSchemaList.documentation: A structure containing the list of column schemas.

Operator.documentation:
The comparison operator that you want to use as a filter, for example "Operator": "StringEquals". Valid values are "StringEquals" and "StringLike".

If you set the operator value to "StringEquals", you need to provide an ownership related filter in the "NAME" field and the arn of the user or group whose datasets you want to search in the "Value" field. For example, "Name":"QUICKSIGHT_OWNER", "Operator": "StringEquals", "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east- 1:1:user/default/UserName1".

If you set the value to "StringLike", you need to provide the name of the datasets you are searching for. For example, "Name":"DATASET_NAME", "Operator": "StringLike", "Value": "Test". The "StringLike" operator only supports the NAME value DATASET_NAME.

Name.documentation:
The name of the value that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Name": "QUICKSIGHT_OWNER".

Valid values are defined as follows:

  • QUICKSIGHT_VIEWER_OR_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the dataset owners or viewers are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are considered.

  • QUICKSIGHT_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the owners of the dataset are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are considered.

  • DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_SOLE_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as the only owner of the dataset are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are not considered.

  • DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the owners if the dataset are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are not considered.

  • DIRECT_QUICKSIGHT_VIEWER_OR_OWNER: Provide an ARN of a user or group, and any datasets with that ARN listed as one of the owners or viewers of the dataset are returned. Implicit permissions from folders or groups are not considered.

  • DATASET_NAME: Any datasets whose names have a substring match to this value will be returned.

Value.documentation: The value of the named item, in this case QUICKSIGHT_OWNER, that you want to use as a filter, for example, "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:user/default/UserName1".

DataSetSearchFilter.documentation: A filter that you apply when searching for datasets.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID of the dataset.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that this dataset was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The last time that this dataset was updated.

ImportMode.documentation: A value that indicates whether you want to import the data into SPICE.

RowLevelPermissionDataSet.documentation: The row-level security configuration for the dataset.

RowLevelPermissionTagConfigurationApplie.documentation: Whether or not the row level permission tags are applied.

ColumnLevelPermissionRulesApplied.documentation: A value that indicates if the dataset has column level permission configured.

DisableUseAsDirectQuerySource.documentation: An option that controls whether a child dataset of a direct query can use this dataset as a source.

DisableUseAsImportedSource.documentation: An option that controls whether a child dataset that's stored in QuickSight can use this dataset as a source.

DataSetUsageConfiguration.documentation: The usage configuration to apply to child datasets that reference this dataset as a source.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data source.

DataSourceId.documentation: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

Name.documentation: A display name for the data source.

Type.documentation: The type of the data source. This type indicates which database engine the data source connects to.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that this data source was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The last time that this data source was updated.

DataSourceParameters.documentation: The parameters that Amazon QuickSight uses to connect to your underlying source. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

AlternateDataSourceParameters.documentation: A set of alternate data source parameters that you want to share for the credentials stored with this data source. The credentials are applied in tandem with the data source parameters when you copy a data source by using a create or update request. The API operation compares the DataSourceParameters structure that's in the request with the structures in the AlternateDataSourceParameters allow list. If the structures are an exact match, the request is allowed to use the credentials from this existing data source. If the AlternateDataSourceParameters list is null, the Credentials originally used with this DataSourceParameters are automatically allowed.

VpcConnectionProperties.documentation: The VPC connection information. You need to use this parameter only when you want QuickSight to use a VPC connection when connecting to your underlying source.

SslProperties.documentation: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) properties that apply when QuickSight connects to your underlying source.

ErrorInfo.documentation: Error information from the last update or the creation of the data source.

SecretArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret associated with the data source in Amazon Secrets Manager.

CopySourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a data source that has the credential pair that you want to use. When CopySourceArn is not null, the credential pair from the data source in the ARN is used as the credentials for the DataSourceCredentials structure.

SecretArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret associated with the data source in Amazon Secrets Manager.

DataSourceCredentials.documentation: Data source credentials. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

Type.documentation: Error type.

DataSourceErrorInfo.documentation: Error information for the data source creation or update.

DatabricksParameters.documentation: The parameters that are required to connect to a Databricks data source.
