The pattern type of the line style. Choose one of the following options:

  • SOLID

  • DASHED

  • DOTTED

Color.documentation: The hex color of the reference line.

ReferenceLineStyleConfiguration.documentation: The style configuration of the reference line.

RelativePosition.documentation:
The relative position of the value label. Choose one of the following options:

  • BEFORE_CUSTOM_LABEL

  • AFTER_CUSTOM_LABEL

FormatConfiguration.documentation: The format configuration of the value label.

ReferenceLineValueLabelConfiguration.documentation: The value label configuration of the label in a reference line.

EmailAlert.documentation: The email alert configuration for a dataset refresh failure.

AlertStatus.documentation: The status value that determines if email alerts are sent.

RefreshFailureEmailAlert.documentation: The configuration settings for the email alerts that are sent when a dataset refresh fails.

Interval.documentation:
The interval between scheduled refreshes. Valid values are as follows:

  • MINUTE15: The dataset refreshes every 15 minutes. This value is only supported for incremental refreshes. This interval can only be used for one schedule per dataset.

  • MINUTE30:The dataset refreshes every 30 minutes. This value is only supported for incremental refreshes. This interval can only be used for one schedule per dataset.

  • HOURLY: The dataset refreshes every hour. This interval can only be used for one schedule per dataset.

  • DAILY: The dataset refreshes every day.

  • WEEKLY: The dataset refreshes every week.

  • MONTHLY: The dataset refreshes every month.

RefreshOnDay.documentation: The day of the week that you want to schedule the refresh on. This value is required for weekly and monthly refresh intervals.

Timezone.documentation: The timezone that you want the refresh schedule to use. The timezone ID must match a corresponding ID found on java.util.time.getAvailableIDs().

TimeOfTheDay.documentation: The time of day that you want the datset to refresh. This value is expressed in HH:MM format. This field is not required for schedules that refresh hourly.

RefreshFrequency.documentation: Specifies the interval between each scheduled refresh of a dataset.

StartAfterDateTime.documentation: Time after which the refresh schedule can be started, expressed in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS format.

RefreshType.documentation:
The type of refresh that a datset undergoes. Valid values are as follows:

  • FULL_REFRESH: A complete refresh of a dataset.

  • INCREMENTAL_REFRESH: A partial refresh of some rows of a dataset, based on the time window specified.

For more information on full and incremental refreshes, see Refreshing SPICE data in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the refresh schedule.

IdentityType.documentation: The identity type that your QuickSight account uses to manage the identity of users.

Email.documentation: The email address of the user that you want to register.

UserRole.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight role for the user. The user role can be one of the following:

  • READER: A user who has read-only access to dashboards.

  • AUTHOR: A user who can create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards.

  • ADMIN: A user who is an author, who can also manage Amazon QuickSight settings.

  • READER_PRO: Reader Pro adds Generative BI capabilities to the Reader role. Reader Pros have access to Amazon Q in QuickSight, can build stories with Amazon Q, and can generate executive summaries from dashboards.

  • AUTHOR_PRO: Author Pro adds Generative BI capabilities to the Author role. Author Pros can author dashboards with natural language with Amazon Q, build stories with Amazon Q, create Topics for Q&A, and generate executive summaries from dashboards.

  • ADMIN_PRO: Admin Pros are Author Pros who can also manage Amazon QuickSight administrative settings. Admin Pro users are billed at Author Pro pricing.

  • RESTRICTED_READER: This role isn't currently available for use.

  • RESTRICTED_AUTHOR: This role isn't currently available for use.

IamArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM user or role that you are registering with Amazon QuickSight.

SessionName.documentation: You need to use this parameter only when you register one or more users using an assumed IAM role. You don't need to provide the session name for other scenarios, for example when you are registering an IAM user or an Amazon QuickSight user. You can register multiple users using the same IAM role if each user has a different session name. For more information on assuming IAM roles, see assume-role in the CLI Reference.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the user is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace. Currently, you should set this to default.

UserName.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight user name that you want to create for the user you are registering.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation:
(Enterprise edition only) The name of the custom permissions profile that you want to assign to this user. Customized permissions allows you to control a user's access by restricting access the following operations:

  • Create and update data sources

  • Create and update datasets

  • Create and update email reports

  • Subscribe to email reports

To add custom permissions to an existing user, use UpdateUser instead.

A set of custom permissions includes any combination of these restrictions. Currently, you need to create the profile names for custom permission sets by using the QuickSight console. Then, you use the RegisterUser API operation to assign the named set of permissions to a QuickSight user.

QuickSight custom permissions are applied through IAM policies. Therefore, they override the permissions typically granted by assigning QuickSight users to one of the default security cohorts in QuickSight (admin, author, reader, admin pro, author pro, reader pro).

This feature is available only to QuickSight Enterprise edition subscriptions.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderType.documentation:
The type of supported external login provider that provides identity to let a user federate into Amazon QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. The type of supported external login provider can be one of the following.

  • COGNITO: Amazon Cognito. The provider URL is cognito-identity.amazonaws.com. When choosing the COGNITO provider type, dont use the "CustomFederationProviderUrl" parameter which is only needed when the external provider is custom.

  • CUSTOM_OIDC: Custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider. When choosing CUSTOM_OIDC type, use the CustomFederationProviderUrl parameter to provide the custom OIDC provider URL.

CustomFederationProviderUrl.documentation: The URL of the custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider that provides identity to let a user federate into QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. This parameter should only be used when ExternalLoginFederationProviderType parameter is set to CUSTOM_OIDC.

ExternalLoginId.documentation: The identity ID for a user in the external login provider.

Tags.documentation: The tags to associate with the user.

UserInvitationUrl.documentation: The URL the user visits to complete registration and provide a password. This is returned only for users with an identity type of QUICKSIGHT.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

KeyArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that is registered to a QuickSight account for encryption and decryption use.

DefaultKey.documentation: Indicates whether a RegisteredCustomerManagedKey is set as the default key for encryption and decryption use.

RegisteredCustomerManagedKey.documentation:
A customer managed key structure that contains the information listed below:

  • KeyArn - The ARN of a KMS key that is registered to a QuickSight account for encryption and decryption use.

  • DefaultKey - Indicates whether the current key is set as the default key for encryption and decryption use.

StatePersistence.documentation: The state persistence configurations of an embedded QuickSight console.

SharedView.documentation: The shared view settings of an embedded dashboard.

AmazonQInQuickSight.documentation: The Amazon Q configurations of an embedded QuickSight console.

Schedules.documentation: The schedules configuration for an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

RecentSnapshots.documentation: The recent snapshots configuration for an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

ThresholdAlerts.documentation: The threshold alerts configuration for an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

RegisteredUserConsoleFeatureConfiguratio.documentation: The feature configurations of an embedded QuickSight console.

InitialDashboardId.documentation:
The dashboard ID for the dashboard that you want the user to see first. This ID is included in the output URL. When the URL in response is accessed, QuickSight renders this dashboard if the user has permissions to view it.

If the user does not have permission to view this dashboard, they see a permissions error message.

FeatureConfigurations.documentation: The feature configurations of an embbedded QuickSight dashboard.

RegisteredUserDashboardEmbeddingConfigur.documentation: Information about the dashboard you want to embed.

StatePersistence.documentation: The state persistence settings of an embedded dashboard.

SharedView.documentation: The shared view settings of an embedded dashboard.

Bookmarks.documentation: The bookmarks configuration for an embedded dashboard in QuickSight.

AmazonQInQuickSight.documentation: The Amazon Q configurations of an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

Schedules.documentation: The schedules configuration for an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

RecentSnapshots.documentation: The recent snapshots configuration for an QuickSight embedded dashboard

ThresholdAlerts.documentation: The threshold alerts configuration for an QuickSight embedded dashboard.

RegisteredUserDashboardFeatureConfigurat.documentation: The feature configuration for an embedded dashboard.

InitialDashboardVisualId.documentation:
The visual ID for the visual that you want the user to embed. This ID is included in the output URL. When the URL in response is accessed, QuickSight renders this visual.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dashboard that the visual belongs to must be included in the AuthorizedResourceArns parameter. Otherwise, the request will fail with InvalidParameterValueException.

RegisteredUserDashboardVisualEmbeddingCo.documentation: The experience that you are embedding. You can use this object to generate a url that embeds a visual into your application.

Dashboard.documentation: The configuration details for providing a dashboard embedding experience.

QuickSightConsole.documentation:
The configuration details for providing each QuickSight console embedding experience. This can be used along with custom permissions to restrict access to certain features. For more information, see Customizing Access to the QuickSight Console in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

Use GenerateEmbedUrlForRegisteredUser where you want to provide an authoring portal that allows users to create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards. The users who accesses an embedded QuickSight console needs to belong to the author or admin security cohort. If you want to restrict permissions to some of these features, add a custom permissions profile to the user with the UpdateUser API operation. Use the RegisterUser API operation to add a new user with a custom permission profile attached. For more information, see the following sections in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide:

  • Embedding the Full Functionality of the QuickSight Console for Authenticated Users

  • Customizing Access to the Amazon QuickSight Console

For more information about the high-level steps for embedding and for an interactive demo of the ways you can customize embedding, visit the Amazon QuickSight Developer Portal.

QSearchBar.documentation:
The configuration details for embedding the Q search bar.

For more information about embedding the Q search bar, see Embedding Overview in the QuickSight User Guide.

DashboardVisual.documentation: The type of embedding experience. In this case, QuickSight visuals.

GenerativeQnA.documentation:
The configuration details for embedding the Generative Q&A experience.

For more information about embedding the Generative Q&A experience, see Embedding Overview in the QuickSight User Guide.

RegisteredUserEmbeddingExperienceConfigu.documentation:
The type of experience you want to embed. For registered users, you can embed QuickSight dashboards or the QuickSight console.

Exactly one of the experience configurations is required. You can choose Dashboard or QuickSightConsole. You cannot choose more than one experience configuration.

InitialTopicId.documentation:
The ID of the new Q reader experience topic that you want to make the starting topic in the Generative Q&A experience. You can find a topic ID by navigating to the Topics pane in the QuickSight application and opening a topic. The ID is in the URL for the topic that you open.

If you don't specify an initial topic or you specify a legacy topic, a list of all shared new reader experience topics is shown in the Generative Q&A experience for your readers. When you select an initial new reader experience topic, you can specify whether or not readers are allowed to select other new reader experience topics from the available ones in the list.

RegisteredUserGenerativeQnAEmbeddingConf.documentation: An object that provides information about the configuration of a Generative Q&A experience.

InitialTopicId.documentation:
The ID of the legacy Q topic that you want to use as the starting topic in the Q search bar. To locate the topic ID of the topic that you want to use, open the QuickSight console, navigate to the Topics pane, and choose thre topic that you want to use. The TopicID is located in the URL of the topic that opens. When you select an initial topic, you can specify whether or not readers are allowed to select other topics from the list of available topics.

If you don't specify an initial topic or if you specify a new reader experience topic, a list of all shared legacy topics is shown in the Q bar.

RegisteredUserQSearchBarEmbeddingConfigu.documentation: Information about the Q search bar embedding experience.

InitialPath.documentation:
The initial URL path for the QuickSight console. InitialPath is required.

The entry point URL is constrained to the following paths:

  • /start

  • /start/analyses

  • /start/dashboards

  • /start/favorites

  • /dashboards/DashboardId. DashboardId is the actual ID key from the QuickSight console URL of the dashboard.

  • /analyses/AnalysisId. AnalysisId is the actual ID key from the QuickSight console URL of the analysis.

FeatureConfigurations.documentation: The embedding configuration of an embedded QuickSight console.

RegisteredUserQuickSightConsoleEmbedding.documentation: Information about the QuickSight console that you want to embed.

DataSourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the data source.

Schema.documentation: The schema name. This name applies to certain relational database engines.

RelationalTable.documentation: A physical table type for relational data sources.

TitleOptions.documentation: The options to configure the title visibility, name, and font size.

DateTimeFormat.documentation: Customize how dates are formatted in controls.

InfoIconLabelOptions.documentation: The configuration of info icon label options.

FilterId.documentation: An identifier that uniquely identifies a filter within a dashboard, analysis, or template.

Column.documentation: The column that the filter is applied to.

MinimumGranularity.documentation: The minimum granularity (period granularity) of the relative dates filter.

TimeGranularity.documentation: The level of time precision that is used to aggregate DateTime values.

RelativeDateType.documentation:
The range date type of the filter. Choose one of the options below:

  • PREVIOUS

  • THIS

  • LAST

  • NOW

  • NEXT

ParameterName.documentation: The parameter whose value should be used for the filter value.

NullOption.documentation:
This option determines how null values should be treated when filtering data.

  • ALL_VALUES: Include null values in filtered results.

  • NULLS_ONLY: Only include null values in filtered results.

  • NON_NULLS_ONLY: Exclude null values from filtered results.

ExcludePeriodConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for the exclude period of the filter.

DefaultFilterControlConfiguration.documentation: The default configurations for the associated controls. This applies only for filters that are scoped to multiple sheets.

ColumnName.documentation: The name of the column to be renamed.

RenameColumnOperation.documentation: A transform operation that renames a column.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.
The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: One or more resources can't be found.

Principal.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal. This can be one of the following:

  • The ARN of an Amazon QuickSight user or group associated with a data source or dataset. (This is common.)

  • The ARN of an Amazon QuickSight user, group, or namespace associated with an analysis, dashboard, template, or theme. (This is common.)

  • The ARN of an Amazon Web Services account root: This is an IAM ARN rather than a QuickSight ARN. Use this option only to share resources (templates) across Amazon Web Services accounts. (This is less common.)

Actions.documentation: The IAM action to grant or revoke permissions on.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analysis.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis that you're restoring.

RestoreToFolders.documentation: A boolean value that determines if the analysis will be restored to folders that it previously resided in. A True value restores analysis back to all folders that it previously resided in. A False value restores the analysis but does not restore the analysis back to all previously resided folders. Restoring a restricted analysis requires this parameter to be set to True.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the analysis that you're restoring.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis that you're restoring.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

RestorationFailedFolderArns.documentation: A list of folder arns thatthe analysis failed to be restored to.

DataSetIdentifier.documentation: The data set that is used in the rolling date configuration.

Expression.documentation: The expression of the rolling date configuration.

RollingDateConfiguration.documentation: The rolling date configuration of a date time filter.

RowAlternateColors.documentation: Determines the list of row alternate colors.

UsePrimaryBackgroundColor.documentation: The primary background color options for alternate rows.

RowsIngested.documentation: The number of rows that were ingested.

RowsDropped.documentation: The number of rows that were not ingested.

TotalRowsInDataset.documentation: The total number of rows in the dataset.

RowInfo.documentation: Information about rows for a data set SPICE ingestion.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace associated with the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

PermissionPolicy.documentation: The type of permissions to use when interpreting the permissions for RLS. DENY_ACCESS is included for backward compatibility only.

FormatVersion.documentation:
The user or group rules associated with the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

By default, FormatVersion is VERSION_1. When FormatVersion is VERSION_1, UserName and GroupName are required. When FormatVersion is VERSION_2, UserARN and GroupARN are required, and Namespace must not exist.

Status.documentation: The status of the row-level security permission dataset. If enabled, the status is ENABLED. If disabled, the status is DISABLED.

RowLevelPermissionDataSet.documentation:
Information about a dataset that contains permissions for row-level security (RLS). The permissions dataset maps fields to users or groups. For more information, see Using Row-Level Security (RLS) to Restrict Access to a Dataset in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

The option to deny permissions by setting PermissionPolicy to DENY_ACCESS is not supported for new RLS datasets.

Status.documentation: The status of row-level security tags. If enabled, the status is ENABLED. If disabled, the status is DISABLED.

TagRules.documentation: A set of rules associated with row-level security, such as the tag names and columns that they are assigned to.

TagRuleConfigurations.documentation: A list of tag configuration rules to apply to a dataset. All tag configurations have the OR condition. Tags within each tile will be joined (AND). At least one rule in this structure must have all tag values assigned to it to apply Row-level security (RLS) to the dataset.

RowLevelPermissionTagConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of tags on a dataset to set row-level security.

ColumnName.documentation: The column name that a tag key is assigned to.

TagMultiValueDelimiter.documentation: A string that you want to use to delimit the values when you pass the values at run time. For example, you can delimit the values with a comma.

MatchAllValue.documentation: A string that you want to use to filter by all the values in a column in the dataset and dont want to list the values one by one. For example, you can use an asterisk as your match all value.

RowLevelPermissionTagRule.documentation: A set of rules associated with a tag.

BucketName.documentation: The name of an existing Amazon S3 bucket where the generated snapshot artifacts are sent.

BucketPrefix.documentation: The prefix of the Amazon S3 bucket that the generated snapshots are stored in.

BucketRegion.documentation: The region that the Amazon S3 bucket is located in. The bucket must be located in the same region that the StartDashboardSnapshotJob API call is made.

S3BucketConfiguration.documentation: An optional structure that contains the Amazon S3 bucket configuration that the generated snapshots are stored in. If you don't provide this information, generated snapshots are stored in the default QuickSight bucket.

ManifestFileLocation.documentation: Location of the Amazon S3 manifest file. This is NULL if the manifest file was uploaded into QuickSight.

RoleArn.documentation: Use the RoleArn structure to override an account-wide role for a specific S3 data source. For example, say an account administrator has turned off all S3 access with an account-wide role. The administrator can then use RoleArn to bypass the account-wide role and allow S3 access for the single S3 data source that is specified in the structure, even if the account-wide role forbidding S3 access is still active.

DataSourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the data source.

UploadSettings.documentation: Information about the format for the S3 source file or files.

InputColumns.documentation:
A physical table type for an S3 data source.

For files that aren't JSON, only STRING data types are supported in input columns.

S3Source.documentation: A physical table type for an S3 data source.

TargetVisuals.documentation: A list of the target visual IDs that are located in the same sheet of the analysis.

TargetVisualOptions.documentation:
The options that choose the target visual in the same sheet.

Valid values are defined as follows:

  • ALL_VISUALS: Applies the filter operation to all visuals in the same sheet.

SameSheetTargetVisualConfiguration.documentation:
The configuration of the same-sheet target visuals that you want to be filtered.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

Source.documentation: The source field wells of a sankey diagram.

Destination.documentation: The destination field wells of a sankey diagram.

Weight.documentation: The weight field wells of a sankey diagram.

SankeyDiagramAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The field well configuration of a sankey diagram.

FieldWells.documentation: The field well configuration of a sankey diagram.

SortConfiguration.documentation: The sort configuration of a sankey diagram.

DataLabels.documentation: The data label configuration of a sankey diagram.

Interactions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for a visual.

SankeyDiagramAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The field well configuration of a sankey diagram.

SankeyDiagramFieldWells.documentation: The field well configuration of a sankey diagram.

WeightSort.documentation: The sort configuration of the weight fields.

SourceItemsLimit.documentation: The limit on the number of source nodes that are displayed in a sankey diagram.

DestinationItemsLimit.documentation: The limit on the number of destination nodes that are displayed in a sankey diagram.

SankeyDiagramSortConfiguration.documentation: The sort configuration of a sankey diagram.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers.

Title.documentation: The title that is displayed on the visual.

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

SankeyDiagramVisual.documentation:
A sankey diagram.

For more information, see Using Sankey diagrams in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

XAxis.documentation:
The x-axis field well of a scatter plot.

The x-axis is aggregated by category.

YAxis.documentation:
The y-axis field well of a scatter plot.

The y-axis is aggregated by category.

Category.documentation: The category field well of a scatter plot.

Size.documentation: The size field well of a scatter plot.

Label.documentation: The label field well of a scatter plot.

ScatterPlotCategoricallyAggregatedFieldW.documentation: The aggregated field well of a scatter plot.

SortConfiguration.documentation: The sort configuration of a scatter plot.

XAxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility, and sort icon visibility) of the scatter plot's x-axis.

XAxisDisplayOptions.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, and axis step) of the scatter plot's x-axis.

YAxisLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility, and sort icon visibility) of the scatter plot's y-axis.

YAxisDisplayOptions.documentation: The label display options (grid line, range, scale, and axis step) of the scatter plot's y-axis.

Legend.documentation: The legend display setup of the visual.

DataLabels.documentation: The options that determine if visual data labels are displayed.

Tooltip.documentation: The legend display setup of the visual.

VisualPalette.documentation: The palette (chart color) display setup of the visual.

Interactions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for a visual.

ScatterPlotCategoricallyAggregatedFieldW.documentation: The aggregated field wells of a scatter plot. The x and y-axes of scatter plots with aggregated field wells are aggregated by category, label, or both.

ScatterPlotUnaggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The unaggregated field wells of a scatter plot. The x and y-axes of these scatter plots are unaggregated.

ScatterPlotFieldWells.documentation:
The field well configuration of a scatter plot.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

ScatterPlotSortConfiguration.documentation: The sort configuration of a scatter plot.

XAxis.documentation:
The x-axis field well of a scatter plot.

The x-axis is a dimension field and cannot be aggregated.

YAxis.documentation:
The y-axis field well of a scatter plot.

The y-axis is a dimension field and cannot be aggregated.

Size.documentation: The size field well of a scatter plot.

Category.documentation: The category field well of a scatter plot.

Label.documentation: The label field well of a scatter plot.

ScatterPlotUnaggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The unaggregated field wells of a scatter plot.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers.

Title.documentation: The title that is displayed on the visual.

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

ColumnHierarchies.documentation: The column hierarchy that is used during drill-downs and drill-ups.

ScatterPlotVisual.documentation:
A scatter plot.

For more information, see Using scatter plots in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

DayOfWeek.documentation: The day of the week that you want to schedule a refresh on.

DayOfMonth.documentation: The day of the month that you want to schedule refresh on.

ScheduleRefreshOnEntity.documentation: The refresh on entity for weekly or monthly schedules.

Enabled.documentation: The schedules configuration for an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

SchedulesConfigurations.documentation: The schedules configuration for an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the data zoom scroll bar.

VisibleRange.documentation: The visibility range for the data zoom scroll bar.

ScrollBarOptions.documentation: The visual display options for a data zoom scroll bar.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analyses that you're searching for.

Filters.documentation: The structure for the search filters that you want to apply to your search.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return.

AnalysisSummaryList.documentation: Metadata describing the analyses that you searched for.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the user whose dashboards you're searching for.

Filters.documentation: The filters to apply to the search. Currently, you can search only by user name, for example, "Filters": [ { "Name": "QUICKSIGHT_USER", "Operator": "StringEquals", "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:user/default/UserName1" } ]

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

DashboardSummaryList.documentation: The list of dashboards owned by the user specified in Filters in your request.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

Filters.documentation: The filters to apply to the search.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

DataSetSummaries.documentation: A DataSetSummaries object that returns a summary of a dataset.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

Filters.documentation: The filters to apply to the search.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

DataSourceSummaries.documentation: A DataSourceSummaries object that returns a summary of a data source.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains the folder.

Filters.documentation: The filters to apply to the search. Currently, you can search only by the parent folder ARN. For example, "Filters": [ { "Name": "PARENT_FOLDER_ARN", "Operator": "StringEquals", "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:folder/folderId" } ].

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

FolderSummaryList.documentation: A structure that contains all of the folders in the Amazon Web Services account. This structure provides basic information about the folders.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the group is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return from this request.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that you want to search.

Filters.documentation: The structure for the search filters that you want to apply to your search.

GroupList.documentation: A list of groups in a specified namespace that match the filters you set in your SearchGroups request.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the topic that you want to find.

Filters.documentation: The filters that you want to use to search for the topic.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

TopicSummaryList.documentation: A list of topic summaries that is returned by the search topic request.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

Visibility.documentation: Determines the visibility of the secondary value.

SecondaryValueOptions.documentation: The options that determine the presentation of the secondary value of a KPI visual.

Status.documentation: The option that enables or disables a page break at the end of a section.

SectionAfterPageBreak.documentation: The configuration of a page break after a section.

PaperCanvasSizeOptions.documentation: The options for a paper canvas of a section-based layout.

SectionBasedLayoutCanvasSizeOptions.documentation: The options for the canvas of a section-based layout.

CanvasSizeOptions.documentation: The options for the canvas of a section-based layout.

PaperSize.documentation: The paper size that is used to define canvas dimensions.

PaperOrientation.documentation:
The paper orientation that is used to define canvas dimensions. Choose one of the following options:

  • PORTRAIT

  • LANDSCAPE

PaperMargin.documentation: Defines the spacing between the canvas content and the top, bottom, left, and right edges.

SectionBasedLayoutPaperCanvasSizeOptions.documentation: The options for a paper canvas of a section-based layout.

FreeFormLayout.documentation: The free-form layout configuration of a section.

After.documentation: The configuration of a page break after a section.

SectionPageBreakConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of a page break for a section.

Height.documentation:
The height of a section.

Heights can only be defined for header and footer sections. The default height margin is 0.5 inches.

Padding.documentation:
The spacing between section content and its top, bottom, left, and right edges.

There is no padding by default.

SheetVisualScopingConfigurations.documentation: The sheet ID and visual IDs of the sheet and visuals that the filter is applied to.

SelectedSheetsFilterScopeConfiguration.documentation:
The configuration for applying a filter to specific sheets or visuals. You can apply this filter to multiple visuals that are on one sheet or to all visuals on a sheet.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

SemanticEntityType.documentation: A structure that represents a semantic entity type.

TruthyCellValueSynonyms.documentation: The other names or aliases for the true cell value.

FalseyCellValueSynonyms.documentation: The other names or aliases for the false cell value.

SemanticType.documentation: A structure that represents a semantic type.

FieldSeriesItem.documentation: The field series item configuration of a line chart.

DataFieldSeriesItem.documentation: The data field series item configuration of a line chart.

SeriesItem.documentation:
The series item configuration of a line chart.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

SessionLifetimeInMinutesInvalidException.documentation: The number of minutes specified for the lifetime of a session isn't valid. The session lifetime must be 15-600 minutes.

Value.documentation: The value that you want to assign the tag.

SessionTag.documentation: The key-value pair used for the row-level security tags feature.

SetParameterValueConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of adding parameters in action.

BackgroundColor.documentation: The conditional formatting for the shape background color of a filled map visual.

ShapeConditionalFormat.documentation: The shape conditional formatting of a filled map visual.

Enabled.documentation: The shared view settings of an embedded dashboard.

SharedViewConfigurations.documentation: The shared view settings of an embedded dashboard.

SheetId.documentation: The unique identifier associated with a sheet.

Name.documentation: The name of a sheet. This name is displayed on the sheet's tab in the QuickSight console.

Images.documentation: A list of images on a sheet.

Sheet.documentation: A sheet, which is an object that contains a set of visuals that are viewed together on one page in Amazon QuickSight. Every analysis and dashboard contains at least one sheet. Each sheet contains at least one visualization widget, for example a chart, pivot table, or narrative insight. Sheets can be associated with other components, such as controls, filters, and so on.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility configuration of info icon label options.

InfoIconText.documentation: The text content of info icon.

SheetControlInfoIconLabelOptions.documentation: A control to display info icons for filters and parameters.

Configuration.documentation: The configuration that determines the elements and canvas size options of sheet control.

SheetControlLayout.documentation: A grid layout to define the placement of sheet control.

GridLayout.documentation: The configuration that determines the elements and canvas size options of sheet control.

SheetControlLayoutConfiguration.documentation: The configuration that determines the elements and canvas size options of sheet control.

Title.documentation: The title of the sheet.

Name.documentation: The name of the sheet. This name is displayed on the sheet's tab in the QuickSight console.

ParameterControls.documentation:
The list of parameter controls that are on a sheet.

For more information, see Using a Control with a Parameter in Amazon QuickSight in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

FilterControls.documentation:
The list of filter controls that are on a sheet.

For more information, see Adding filter controls to analysis sheets in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

Visuals.documentation: A list of the visuals that are on a sheet. Visual placement is determined by the layout of the sheet.

TextBoxes.documentation: The text boxes that are on a sheet.

Images.documentation: A list of images on a sheet.

Layouts.documentation:
Layouts define how the components of a sheet are arranged.

For more information, see Types of layout in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

ContentType.documentation:
The layout content type of the sheet. Choose one of the following options:

  • PAGINATED: Creates a sheet for a paginated report.

  • INTERACTIVE: Creates a sheet for an interactive dashboard.

CustomActionDefaults.documentation: A list of visual custom actions for the sheet.

SheetDefinition.documentation: A sheet is an object that contains a set of visuals that are viewed together on one page in a paginated report. Every analysis and dashboard must contain at least one sheet.

Visibility.documentation:
Determines whether or not the overrides are visible. Choose one of the following options:

  • VISIBLE

  • HIDDEN

SheetElementConfigurationOverrides.documentation: The override configuration of the rendering rules of a sheet.

Expression.documentation: The expression of the rendering rules of a sheet.

ConfigurationOverrides.documentation: The override configuration of the rendering rules of a sheet.

SheetElementRenderingRule.documentation: The rendering rules of a sheet that uses a free-form layout.

Tooltip.documentation: The tooltip to be shown when hovering over the image.

Interactions.documentation: The general image interactions setup for an image.

Actions.documentation: A list of custom actions that are configured for an image.

SheetImage.documentation: An image that is located on a sheet.

ScalingType.documentation:
The scaling option to use when fitting the image inside the container.

Valid values are defined as follows:

  • SCALE_TO_WIDTH: The image takes up the entire width of the container. The image aspect ratio is preserved.

  • SCALE_TO_HEIGHT: The image takes up the entire height of the container. The image aspect ratio is preserved.

  • SCALE_TO_CONTAINER: The image takes up the entire width and height of the container. The image aspect ratio is not preserved.

  • SCALE_NONE: The image is displayed in its original size and is not scaled to the container.

SheetImageStaticFileSource.documentation: The source of the static file that contains the image.

StaticFileId.documentation: The ID of the static file that contains the image.

SheetImageStaticFileSource.documentation: The source of the static file that contains the image.

TooltipText.documentation: The text that appears in the tooltip.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the tooltip.

SheetImageTooltipConfiguration.documentation: The tooltip configuration for a sheet image.

SheetImageTooltipText.documentation: The text that appears in the sheet image tooltip.

AvailabilityStatus.documentation: The status of the sheet layout maximization options of a dashbaord.

SheetLayoutElementMaximizationOption.documentation: The sheet layout maximization options of a dashbaord.

SheetTextBoxId.documentation: The unique identifier for a text box. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have text boxes that share identifiers.

Content.documentation: The content that is displayed in the text box.

Interactions.documentation: The general textbox interactions setup for a textbox.

SheetId.documentation: The selected sheet that the filter is applied to.

Scope.documentation:
The scope of the applied entities. Choose one of the following options:

  • ALL_VISUALS

  • SELECTED_VISUALS

VisualIds.documentation: The selected visuals that the filter is applied to.

SheetVisualScopingConfiguration.documentation: The filter that is applied to the options.

RichText.documentation: Rich text. Examples of rich text include bold, underline, and italics.

ShortFormatText.documentation:
The text format for the title.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

IAMUser.documentation: A Boolean that is TRUE if the QuickSight uses IAM as an authentication method.

userLoginName.documentation: The user login name for your QuickSight account.

directoryType.documentation: The type of Active Directory that is being used to authenticate the QuickSight account. Valid values are SIMPLE_AD, AD_CONNECTOR, and MICROSOFT_AD.

SignupResponse.documentation: A SignupResponse object that contains a summary of a newly created account.

Color.documentation: The color of the simple cluster marker.

SimpleClusterMarker.documentation: The simple cluster marker of the cluster marker.

YAxisOptions.documentation: The Y axis options of a single axis configuration.

SingleAxisOptions.documentation: The settings of a chart's single axis configuration.

TitleOptions.documentation: The options to configure the title visibility, name, and font size.

InfoIconLabelOptions.documentation: The configuration of info icon label options.

VisualId.documentation: The visual ID for the slot.

Scale.documentation: Determines whether scale of the axes are shared or independent. The default value is SHARED.

Placement.documentation: Defines the placement of the axis. By default, axes are rendered OUTSIDE of the panels. Axes with INDEPENDENT scale are rendered INSIDE the panels.

SmallMultiplesAxisProperties.documentation: Configures the properties of a chart's axes that are used by small multiples panels.

MaxVisibleRows.documentation:
Sets the maximum number of visible rows to display in the grid of small multiples panels.

The default value is Auto, which automatically adjusts the rows in the grid to fit the overall layout and size of the given chart.

MaxVisibleColumns.documentation:
Sets the maximum number of visible columns to display in the grid of small multiples panels.

The default is Auto, which automatically adjusts the columns in the grid to fit the overall layout and size of the given chart.

PanelConfiguration.documentation: Configures the display options for each small multiples panel.

XAxis.documentation: The properties of a small multiples X axis.

YAxis.documentation: The properties of a small multiples Y axis.

SmallMultiplesOptions.documentation: Options that determine the layout and display options of a chart's small multiples.

RowLevelPermissionTags.documentation:
The tags to be used for row-level security (RLS). Make sure that the relevant datasets have RLS tags configured before you start a snapshot export job. You can configure the RLS tags of a dataset with a DataSet$RowLevelPermissionTagConfiguration API call.

These are not the tags that are used for Amazon Web Services resource tagging. For more information on row level security in QuickSight, see Using Row-Level Security (RLS) with Tagsin the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

SnapshotAnonymousUser.documentation: A structure that contains information on the anonymous user configuration.

SnapshotAnonymousUserRedacted.documentation: Use this structure to redact sensitive information that you provide about an anonymous user from the snapshot.

FileGroups.documentation: A list of SnapshotJobResultFileGroup objects that contain information about the snapshot that is generated. This list can hold a maximum of 6 FileGroup configurations.

DestinationConfiguration.documentation: A structure that contains information on the Amazon S3 bucket that the generated snapshot is stored in.

SnapshotConfiguration.documentation: Describes the configuration of the dashboard snapshot.

S3Destinations.documentation: A list of SnapshotS3DestinationConfiguration objects that contain Amazon S3 destination configurations. This structure can hold a maximum of 1 S3DestinationConfiguration.

SnapshotDestinationConfiguration.documentation: A structure that contains information on the Amazon S3 destinations of the generated snapshot.

SheetSelections.documentation: A list of SnapshotFileSheetSelection objects that contain information on the dashboard sheet that is exported. These objects provide information about the snapshot artifacts that are generated during the job. This structure can hold a maximum of 5 CSV configurations, 5 Excel configurations, or 1 configuration for PDF.

FormatType.documentation: The format of the snapshot file to be generated. You can choose between CSV, Excel, or PDF.

SnapshotFile.documentation: A structure that contains the information for the snapshot that you want to generate. This information is provided by you when you start a new snapshot job.

Files.documentation: A list of SnapshotFile objects that contain the information on the snapshot files that need to be generated. This structure can hold 1 configuration at a time.

SnapshotFileGroup.documentation: A structure that contains the information on the snapshot files.

SheetId.documentation: The sheet ID of the dashboard to generate the snapshot artifact from. This value is required for CSV, Excel, and PDF format types.

SelectionScope.documentation:
The selection scope of the visuals on a sheet of a dashboard that you are generating a snapthot of. You can choose one of the following options.

  • ALL_VISUALS - Selects all visuals that are on the sheet. This value is required if the snapshot is a PDF.

  • SELECTED_VISUALS - Select the visual that you want to add to the snapshot. This value is required if the snapshot is a CSV or Excel workbook.

VisualIds.documentation: A structure that lists the IDs of the visuals in the selected sheet. Supported visual types are table, pivot table visuals. This value is required if you are generating a CSV or Excel workbook. This value supports a maximum of 1 visual ID for CSV and 5 visual IDs across up to 5 sheet selections for Excel. If you are generating an Excel workbook, the order of the visual IDs provided in this structure determines the order of the worksheets in the Excel file.

SnapshotFileSheetSelection.documentation: A structure that contains information that identifies the snapshot that needs to be generated.

SnapshotJobErrorInfo.documentation: An object that contains information on the error that caused the snapshot job to fail.

AnonymousUsers.documentation: A list of AnonymousUserSnapshotJobResult objects that contain information on anonymous users and their user configurations. This data provided by you when you make a StartDashboardSnapshotJob API call.

SnapshotJobResult.documentation: An object that provides information on the result of a snapshot job. This object provides information about the job, the job status, and the location of the generated file.

SnapshotJobResultErrorInfo.documentation: Information on the error that caused the snapshot job to fail.

SnapshotJobResultFileGroup.documentation: A structure that contains information on the generated snapshot file groups.

S3DestinationConfiguration.documentation: A list of Amazon S3 bucket configurations that are provided when you make a StartDashboardSnapshotJob API call.

ErrorInfo.documentation: An array of error records that describe any failures that occur while the dashboard snapshot job runs.

SnapshotJobS3Result.documentation: The Amazon S3 result from the snapshot job. The result includes the DestinationConfiguration and the Amazon S3 Uri. If an error occured during the job, the result returns information on the error.

BucketConfiguration.documentation: A structure that contains details about the Amazon S3 bucket that the generated dashboard snapshot is saved in.

SnapshotS3DestinationConfiguration.documentation: A structure that describes the Amazon S3 settings to use to save the generated dashboard snapshot.

AnonymousUsers.documentation: An array of records that describe the anonymous users that the dashboard snapshot is generated for.

SnapshotUserConfiguration.documentation: A structure that contains information about the users that the dashboard snapshot is generated for.

AnonymousUsers.documentation: An array of records that describe anonymous users that the dashboard snapshot is generated for. Sensitive user information is excluded.

SnapshotUserConfigurationRedacted.documentation: A structure that contains information about the users that the dashboard snapshot is generated for. Sensitive user information is excluded.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type that you want to use for your connection. This parameter accepts OAuth and non-OAuth authentication types.

OAuthParameters.documentation: An object that contains information needed to create a data source connection between an QuickSight account and Snowflake.

Spacing.documentation: The configuration of spacing (often a margin or padding).

StaticFileId.documentation: The ID of the spatial static file.

Source.documentation: The source of the spatial static file.

SpatialStaticFile.documentation: A static file that contains the geospatial data.

DisableSsl.documentation: A Boolean option to control whether SSL should be disabled.

SslProperties.documentation: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) properties that apply when QuickSight connects to your underlying data source.

Host.documentation: The host name of the Starburst data source.

Port.documentation: The port for the Starburst data source.

Catalog.documentation: The catalog name for the Starburst data source.

ProductType.documentation: The product type for the Starburst data source.

AuthenticationType.documentation: The authentication type that you want to use for your connection. This parameter accepts OAuth and non-OAuth authentication types.

OAuthParameters.documentation: An object that contains information needed to create a data source connection between an QuickSight account and Starburst.

StarburstParameters.documentation: The parameters that are required to connect to a Starburst data source.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account to export assets from.

AssetBundleExportJobId.documentation: The ID of the job. This ID is unique while the job is running. After the job is completed, you can reuse this ID for another job.

ResourceArns.documentation:
An array of resource ARNs to export. The following resources are supported.

  • Analysis

  • Dashboard

  • DataSet

  • DataSource

  • RefreshSchedule

  • Theme

  • VPCConnection

The API caller must have the necessary permissions in their IAM role to access each resource before the resources can be exported.

IncludeAllDependencies.documentation: A Boolean that determines whether all dependencies of each resource ARN are recursively exported with the job. For example, say you provided a Dashboard ARN to the ResourceArns parameter. If you set IncludeAllDependencies to TRUE, any theme, dataset, and data source resource that is a dependency of the dashboard is also exported.

CloudFormationOverridePropertyConfigurat.documentation:
An optional collection of structures that generate CloudFormation parameters to override the existing resource property values when the resource is exported to a new CloudFormation template.

Use this field if the ExportFormat field of a StartAssetBundleExportJobRequest API call is set to CLOUDFORMATION_JSON.

IncludePermissions.documentation: A Boolean that determines whether all permissions for each resource ARN are exported with the job. If you set IncludePermissions to TRUE, any permissions associated with each resource are exported.

IncludeTags.documentation: A Boolean that determines whether all tags for each resource ARN are exported with the job. If you set IncludeTags to TRUE, any tags associated with each resource are exported.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: An optional parameter that determines which validation strategy to use for the export job. If StrictModeForAllResources is set to TRUE, strict validation for every error is enforced. If it is set to FALSE, validation is skipped for specific UI errors that are shown as warnings. The default value for StrictModeForAllResources is FALSE.

IncludeFolderMemberships.documentation: A Boolean that determines if the exported asset carries over information about the folders that the asset is a member of.

IncludeFolderMembers.documentation: A setting that indicates whether you want to include folder assets. You can also use this setting to recusrsively include all subfolders of an exported folder.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the export job.

AssetBundleExportJobId.documentation: The ID of the job. This ID is unique while the job is running. After the job is completed, you can reuse this ID for another job.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services response ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account to import assets into.

AssetBundleImportJobId.documentation: The ID of the job. This ID is unique while the job is running. After the job is completed, you can reuse this ID for another job.

AssetBundleImportSource.documentation: The source of the asset bundle zip file that contains the data that you want to import. The file must be in QUICKSIGHT_JSON format.

OverrideParameters.documentation: Optional overrides that are applied to the resource configuration before import.

FailureAction.documentation:
The failure action for the import job.

If you choose ROLLBACK, failed import jobs will attempt to undo any asset changes caused by the failed job.

If you choose DO_NOTHING, failed import jobs will not attempt to roll back any asset changes caused by the failed job, possibly keeping the QuickSight account in an inconsistent state.

OverridePermissions.documentation: Optional permission overrides that are applied to the resource configuration before import.

OverrideTags.documentation: Optional tag overrides that are applied to the resource configuration before import.

OverrideValidationStrategy.documentation: An optional validation strategy override for all analyses and dashboards that is applied to the resource configuration before import.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the import job.

AssetBundleImportJobId.documentation: The ID of the job. This ID is unique while the job is running. After the job is completed, you can reuse this ID for another job.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services response ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that the dashboard snapshot job is executed in.

DashboardId.documentation: The ID of the dashboard that you want to start a snapshot job for.

SnapshotJobId.documentation: An ID for the dashboard snapshot job. This ID is unique to the dashboard while the job is running. This ID can be used to poll the status of a job with a DescribeDashboardSnapshotJob while the job runs. You can reuse this ID for another job 24 hours after the current job is completed.

UserConfiguration.documentation: A structure that contains information about the anonymous users that the generated snapshot is for. This API will not return information about registered QuickSight.

SnapshotConfiguration.documentation: A structure that describes the configuration of the dashboard snapshot.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the dashboard snapshot job.

SnapshotJobId.documentation: The ID of the job. The job ID is set when you start a new job with a StartDashboardSnapshotJob API call.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that the dashboard snapshot job is executed in.

DashboardId.documentation: The ID of the dashboard that you want to start a snapshot job schedule for.

ScheduleId.documentation: The ID of the schedule that you want to start a snapshot job schedule for. The schedule ID can be found in the QuickSight console in the Schedules pane of the dashboard that the schedule is configured for.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

Enabled.documentation: Determines if a QuickSight dashboard's state persistence settings are turned on or off.

StatePersistenceConfigurations.documentation: The state perssitence configuration of an embedded dashboard.

BucketName.documentation: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

ObjectKey.documentation: The identifier of the static file in the Amazon S3 bucket.

Region.documentation: The Region of the Amazon S3 account that contains the bucket.

StaticFileS3SourceOptions.documentation: The structure that contains the Amazon S3 location to download the static file from.

UrlOptions.documentation: The structure that contains the URL to download the static file from.

S3Options.documentation: The structure that contains the Amazon S3 location to download the static file from.

Url.documentation: The URL to download the static file from.

StaticFileUrlSourceOptions.documentation: The structure that contains the URL to download the static file from.

Id.documentation: An identifier for the string parameter that is created in the dataset.

Name.documentation: The name of the string parameter that is created in the dataset.

ValueType.documentation: The value type of the dataset parameter. Valid values are single value or multi value.

DefaultValues.documentation: A list of default values for a given string dataset parameter type. This structure only accepts static values.

StringDatasetParameterDefaultValue.documentation: The default value for the string parameter.

StaticValues.documentation: A list of static default values for a given string parameter.

StringDatasetParameterDefaultValues.documentation: The default values of a string parameter.

DynamicValue.documentation: The dynamic value of the StringDefaultValues. Different defaults displayed according to users, groups, and values mapping.

NullValueFormatConfiguration.documentation: The options that determine the null value format configuration.

Name.documentation: A display name for a string parameter.

Values.documentation: The values of a string parameter.

ParameterValueType.documentation: The value type determines whether the parameter is a single-value or multi-value parameter.

Name.documentation: The name of the parameter that is being declared.

DefaultValues.documentation: The default values of a parameter. If the parameter is a single-value parameter, a maximum of one default value can be provided.

ValueWhenUnset.documentation: The configuration that defines the default value of a String parameter when a value has not been set.

StringParameterDeclaration.documentation: A parameter declaration for the String data type.

ValueWhenUnsetOption.documentation:
The built-in options for default values. The value can be one of the following:

  • RECOMMENDED: The recommended value.

  • NULL: The NULL value.

CustomValue.documentation: A custom value that's used when the value of a parameter isn't set.

StringValueWhenUnsetConfiguration.documentation: The configuration that defines the default value of a String parameter when a value has not been set.

TotalsVisibility.documentation: The visibility configuration for the subtotal cells.

CustomLabel.documentation: The custom label string for the subtotal cells.

FieldLevel.documentation: The field level (all, custom, last) for the subtotal cells.

TotalCellStyle.documentation: The cell styling options for the subtotal cells.

ValueCellStyle.documentation: The cell styling options for the subtotals of value cells.

MetricHeaderCellStyle.documentation: The cell styling options for the subtotals of header cells.

KeyArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that is associated with the SuccessfulKeyRegistrationEntry entry.

SuccessfulKeyRegistrationEntry.documentation: A success entry that occurs when a KeyRegistration job is successfully applied to the QuickSight account.

GroupBy.documentation: The group by field well for a pivot table. Values are grouped by group by fields.

Values.documentation: The values field well for a pivot table. Values are aggregated based on group by fields.

TableAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field well for the table.

Style.documentation: The style (none, solid) of a table border.

TableBorderOptions.documentation: The border options for a table border.

FieldId.documentation: The field ID of the cell for conditional formatting.

TextFormat.documentation: The text format of the cell for conditional formatting.

TableCellConditionalFormatting.documentation: The cell conditional formatting option for a table.

TableCellImageScalingConfiguration.documentation: The cell scaling configuration of the sizing options for the table image configuration.

TableCellImageSizingConfiguration.documentation: The sizing options for the table image configuration.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the table cells.

FontConfiguration.documentation: The font configuration of the table cells.

TextWrap.documentation: The text wrap (none, wrap) for the table cells.

HorizontalTextAlignment.documentation: The horizontal text alignment (left, center, right, auto) for the table cells.

VerticalTextAlignment.documentation: The vertical text alignment (top, middle, bottom) for the table cells.

BackgroundColor.documentation: The background color for the table cells.

Height.documentation: The height color for the table cells.

TableCellStyle.documentation: The table cell style for a cell in pivot table or table visual.

Cell.documentation: The cell conditional formatting option for a table.

Row.documentation: The row conditional formatting option for a table.

TableOptions.documentation: The table options for a table visual.

TotalOptions.documentation: The total options for a table visual.

FieldOptions.documentation: The field options for a table visual.

PaginatedReportOptions.documentation: The paginated report options for a table visual.

TableInlineVisualizations.documentation: A collection of inline visualizations to display within a chart.

Interactions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for a visual.

Icon.documentation: The icon set type (link) of the custom icon content for table URL link content.

TableFieldCustomIconContent.documentation: The custom icon content for the table link content configuration.

Value.documentation: The string value of the custom text content for the table URL link content.

FontConfiguration.documentation: The font configuration of the custom text content for the table URL link content.

TableFieldCustomTextContent.documentation: The custom text content (value, font configuration) for the table link content configuration.

SizingOptions.documentation: The sizing options for the table image configuration.

TableFieldImageConfiguration.documentation: The image configuration of a table field URL.

Target.documentation: The URL target (new tab, new window, same tab) for the table link configuration.

Content.documentation: The URL content (text, icon) for the table link configuration.

TableFieldLinkConfiguration.documentation: The link configuration of a table field URL.

CustomTextContent.documentation: The custom text content (value, font configuration) for the table link content configuration.

CustomIconContent.documentation: The custom icon content for the table link content configuration.

TableFieldLinkContentConfiguration.documentation: The URL content (text, icon) for the table link configuration.

FieldId.documentation: The field ID for a table field.

CustomLabel.documentation: The custom label for a table field.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of a table field.

URLStyling.documentation: The URL configuration for a table field.

SelectedFieldOptions.documentation: The field options to be configured to a table.

Order.documentation: The order of the field IDs that are configured as field options for a table visual.

PinnedFieldOptions.documentation: The settings for the pinned columns of a table visual.

TableFieldOptions.documentation: The field options of a table visual.

LinkConfiguration.documentation: The link configuration of a table field URL.

ImageConfiguration.documentation: The image configuration of a table field URL.

TableFieldURLConfiguration.documentation: The URL configuration for a table field.

TableAggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The aggregated field well for the table.

TableUnaggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The unaggregated field well for the table.

TableFieldWells.documentation:
The field wells for a table visual.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

DataBars.documentation: The configuration of the inline visualization of the data bars within a chart.

TableInlineVisualization.documentation: The inline visualization of a specific type to display within a chart.

HeaderStyle.documentation: The table cell style of a table header.

CellStyle.documentation: The table cell style of table cells.

RowAlternateColorOptions.documentation: The row alternate color options (widget status, row alternate colors) for a table.

TableOptions.documentation: The table options for a table visual.

VerticalOverflowVisibility.documentation: The visibility of printing table overflow across pages.

OverflowColumnHeaderVisibility.documentation: The visibility of repeating header rows on each page.

TablePaginatedReportOptions.documentation: The paginated report options for a table visual.

PinnedLeftFields.documentation: A list of columns to be pinned to the left of a table visual.

TablePinnedFieldOptions.documentation: The settings for the pinned columns of a table visual.

BackgroundColor.documentation: The conditional formatting color (solid, gradient) of the background for a table row.

TextColor.documentation: The conditional formatting color (solid, gradient) of the text for a table row.

TableRowConditionalFormatting.documentation: The conditional formatting of a table row.

InnerVertical.documentation: The table border options of the inner vertical border.

InnerHorizontal.documentation: The table border options of the inner horizontal border.

Left.documentation: The table border options of the left border.

Right.documentation: The table border options of the right border.

Top.documentation: The table border options of the top border.

Bottom.documentation: The table border options of the bottom border.

TableSideBorderOptions.documentation: The side border options for a table.

RowSort.documentation: The field sort options for rows in the table.

PaginationConfiguration.documentation: The pagination configuration (page size, page number) for the table.

CellType.documentation: The cell type of the table style target.

Values.documentation: The values field well for a pivot table. Values are unaggregated for an unaggregated table.

TableUnaggregatedFieldWells.documentation: The unaggregated field well for the table.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers..

Title.documentation: The title that is displayed on the visual.

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

TableVisual.documentation:
A table visual.

For more information, see Using tables as visuals in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

Value.documentation: Tag value.

Tag.documentation: The key or keys of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the resource.

ColumnName.documentation: The column that this operation acts on.

Tags.documentation:
The dataset column tag, currently only used for geospatial type tagging.

This is not tags for the Amazon Web Services tagging feature.

TagColumnOperation.documentation: A transform operation that tags a column with additional information.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to tag.

Tags.documentation: Contains a map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the resource.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.

Version.documentation: A structure describing the versions of the template.

TemplateId.documentation: The ID for the template. This is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: Time when this was last updated.

CreatedTime.documentation: Time when this was created.

Template.documentation:
A template object. A template is an entity in QuickSight that encapsulates the metadata required to create an analysis and that you can use to create a dashboard. A template adds a layer of abstraction by using placeholders to replace the dataset associated with an analysis. You can use templates to create dashboards by replacing dataset placeholders with datasets that follow the same schema that was used to create the source analysis and template.

You can share templates across Amazon Web Services accounts by allowing users in other Amazon Web Services accounts to create a template or a dashboard from an existing template.

AliasName.documentation: The display name of the template alias.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template alias.

TemplateVersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the template alias.

Type.documentation: Type of error.

ViolatedEntities.documentation: An error path that shows which entities caused the template error.

TemplateError.documentation: List of errors that occurred when the template version creation failed.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

DataSetReferences.documentation: A structure containing information about the dataset references used as placeholders in the template.

SourceAnalysis.documentation: The source analysis, if it is based on an analysis.

SourceTemplate.documentation: The source template, if it is based on an template.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
A summary of a template.

TemplateId.documentation: The ID of the template. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

LatestVersionNumber.documentation: A structure containing a list of version numbers for the template summary.

CreatedTime.documentation: The last time that this template was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The last time that this template was updated.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that this template version was created.

VersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the template version.

Status.documentation:
The status that is associated with the template.

  • CREATION_IN_PROGRESS

  • CREATION_SUCCESSFUL

  • CREATION_FAILED

  • UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS

  • UPDATE_SUCCESSFUL

  • UPDATE_FAILED

  • DELETED

DataSetConfigurations.documentation: Schema of the dataset identified by the placeholder. Any dashboard created from this template should be bound to new datasets matching the same schema described through this API operation.

CalculatedFields.documentation: An array of calculated field definitions for the template.

ParameterDeclarations.documentation:
An array of parameter declarations for a template.

Parameters are named variables that can transfer a value for use by an action or an object.

For more information, see Parameters in Amazon QuickSight in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

FilterGroups.documentation:
Filter definitions for a template.

For more information, see Filtering Data in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

ColumnConfigurations.documentation: An array of template-level column configurations. Column configurations are used to set default formatting for a column that's used throughout a template.

Options.documentation: An array of option definitions for a template.

PlaceholderOptions.documentation: The configuration of the placeholder options in a text area control.

InfoIconLabelOptions.documentation: The configuration of info icon label options.

TextBoxInteractionOptions.documentation: The general textbox interactions setup for textbox publish options.

AvailabilityStatus.documentation: The availability status of the textbox menu. If the value of this property is set to ENABLED, dashboard readers can interact with the textbox menu.

TextBoxMenuOption.documentation: The menu options for the interactions of a textbox.

BackgroundColor.documentation: The conditional formatting for the text background color.

TextColor.documentation: The conditional formatting for the text color.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility configuration of the placeholder options in a text control.

TextControlPlaceholderOptions.documentation: The configuration of the placeholder options in a text control.

TitleOptions.documentation: The options to configure the title visibility, name, and font size.

PlaceholderOptions.documentation: The configuration of the placeholder options in a text field control.

UIColorPalette.documentation: Color properties that apply to the UI and to charts, excluding the colors that apply to data.

Visibility.documentation: Determines the visibility of the thousands separator.

The DEFAULT value uses the standard international grouping system and groups numbers by the thousands. The LAKHS value uses the Indian numbering system and groups numbers by lakhs and crores.

ThresholdAlertsConfigurations.documentation: The threshold alerts configuration for an embedded QuickSight dashboard.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

Margin.documentation: The margin settings that apply around the outside edge of sheets.

TileLayoutStyle.documentation: The display options for the layout of tiles on a sheet.

This option determines how null values should be treated when filtering data.

The value of a time range filter.

TopicNumericEqualityFilter.documentation: A filter that filters topics based on the value of a numeric field. The filter includes only topics whose numeric field value matches the specified value.

Inclusive.documentation: A Boolean value that indicates whether the endpoints of the numeric range are included in the filter. If set to true, topics whose numeric field value is equal to the endpoint values will be included in the filter. If set to false, topics whose numeric field value is equal to the endpoint values will be excluded from the filter.
