TopicNumericRangeFilter.documentation: A filter that filters topics based on the value of a numeric field. The filter includes only topics whose numeric field value falls within the specified range.

ConstantType.documentation: The data type of the constant value that is used in a range filter. Valid values for this structure are RANGE.

RangeConstant.documentation: The value of the constant that is used to specify the endpoints of a range filter.

TopicRangeFilterConstant.documentation: A constant value that is used in a range filter to specify the endpoints of the range.

The column type of the column in a transposed table. Choose one of the following options:

  • VALUE_COLUMN: Refers to all value columns in the transposed table.

The field wells of a tree map.

PrimaryForeground.documentation: The color of text and other foreground elements that appear over the primary background regions, such as grid lines, borders, table banding, icons, and so on.

SecondaryForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any sheet title, sheet control text, or UI that appears over the secondary background.

DimensionForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any text or other elements that appear over the dimension color.

Measure.documentation: The color that applies to the names of fields that are identified as measures.

The colors description is a hexadecimal color code that consists of six alphanumerical characters, prefixed with #, for example #37BFF5. For more information, see Using Themes in Amazon QuickSight in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

UnlimitedPixelLength.documentation: String based length that is composed of value and unit in px with Integer.MAX_VALUE as maximum value

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

UnsupportedPricingPlanException.documentation:
This error indicates that you are calling an embedding operation in Amazon QuickSight without the required pricing plan on your Amazon Web Services account. Before you can use embedding for anonymous users, a QuickSight administrator needs to add capacity pricing to QuickSight. You can do this on the Manage QuickSight page.

After capacity pricing is added, you can use the GetDashboardEmbedUrl API operation with the --identity-type ANONYMOUS option.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

UnsupportedUserEditionException.documentation: This error indicates that you are calling an operation on an Amazon QuickSight subscription where the edition doesn't include support for that operation. Amazon QuickSight currently has Standard Edition and Enterprise Edition. Not every operation and capability is available in every edition.

ColumnName.documentation: The column that this operation acts on.

TagNames.documentation: The column tags to remove from this column.

UntagColumnOperation.documentation: A transform operation that removes tags associated with a column.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to untag.

TagKeys.documentation: The keys of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the resource.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation: The name of the custom permissions profile that you want to apply to an account.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account for which you want to apply a custom permissions profile.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that you want to update QuickSight customizations for.

AccountCustomization.documentation: The QuickSight customizations you're updating in the current Amazon Web Services Region.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the updated customization for this Amazon Web Services account.

DefaultNamespace.documentation: The default namespace for this Amazon Web Services account. Currently, the default is default. IAM users that register for the first time with QuickSight provide an email address that becomes associated with the default namespace.

NotificationEmail.documentation: The email address that you want QuickSight to send notifications to regarding your Amazon Web Services account or QuickSight subscription.

TerminationProtectionEnabled.documentation: A boolean value that determines whether or not an QuickSight account can be deleted. A True value doesn't allow the account to be deleted and results in an error message if a user tries to make a DeleteAccountSubscription request. A False value will allow the account to be deleted.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analysis whose permissions you're updating. You must be using the Amazon Web Services account that the analysis is in.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis whose permissions you're updating. The ID is part of the analysis URL.

GrantPermissions.documentation: A structure that describes the permissions to add and the principal to add them to.

RevokePermissions.documentation: A structure that describes the permissions to remove and the principal to remove them from.

AnalysisArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the analysis that you updated.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis that you updated permissions for.

Permissions.documentation: A structure that describes the principals and the resource-level permissions on an analysis.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analysis that you're updating.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID for the analysis that you're updating. This ID displays in the URL of the analysis.

Name.documentation: A descriptive name for the analysis that you're updating. This name displays for the analysis in the QuickSight console.

Parameters.documentation: The parameter names and override values that you want to use. An analysis can have any parameter type, and some parameters might accept multiple values.

SourceEntity.documentation: A source entity to use for the analysis that you're updating. This metadata structure contains details that describe a source template and one or more datasets.

ThemeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the theme to apply to the analysis that you're creating. To see the theme in the QuickSight console, make sure that you have access to it.

Definition.documentation:
The definition of an analysis.

A definition is the data model of all features in a Dashboard, Template, or Analysis.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: The option to relax the validation needed to update an analysis with definition objects. This skips the validation step for specific errors.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the analysis that you're updating.

UpdateStatus.documentation: The update status of the last update that was made to the analysis.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account to be updated with a token exchange grant.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace of the QuickSight application.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the brand assignment.

BrandArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the brand.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the brand.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the brand.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the custom permissions profile that you want to update.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation: The name of the custom permissions profile that you want to update.

Capabilities.documentation: A set of actions to include in the custom permissions profile.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom permissions profile.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard whose links you want to update.

LinkEntities.documentation: list of analysis Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to be linked to the dashboard.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

DashboardArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dashboard.

LinkEntities.documentation: A list of analysis Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to be linked to the dashboard.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard whose permissions you're updating.

GrantPermissions.documentation: The permissions that you want to grant on this resource.

RevokePermissions.documentation: The permissions that you want to revoke from this resource.

GrantLinkPermissions.documentation: Grants link permissions to all users in a defined namespace.

RevokeLinkPermissions.documentation: Revokes link permissions from all users in a defined namespace.

DashboardArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dashboard.

Permissions.documentation: Information about the permissions on the dashboard.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

LinkSharingConfiguration.documentation: Updates the permissions of a shared link to an QuickSight dashboard.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard that you're updating.

DashboardArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dashboard.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard that you're updating.

SourceEntity.documentation:
The entity that you are using as a source when you update the dashboard. In SourceEntity, you specify the type of object you're using as source. You can only update a dashboard from a template, so you use a SourceTemplate entity. If you need to update a dashboard from an analysis, first convert the analysis to a template by using the CreateTemplate API operation. For SourceTemplate, specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source template. The SourceTemplate ARN can contain any Amazon Web Services account and any QuickSight-supported Amazon Web Services Region.

Use the DataSetReferences entity within SourceTemplate to list the replacement datasets for the placeholders listed in the original. The schema in each dataset must match its placeholder.

Parameters.documentation: A structure that contains the parameters of the dashboard. These are parameter overrides for a dashboard. A dashboard can have any type of parameters, and some parameters might accept multiple values.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description for the first version of the dashboard being created.

DashboardPublishOptions.documentation:
Options for publishing the dashboard when you create it:

  • AvailabilityStatus for AdHocFilteringOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. When this is set to DISABLED, QuickSight disables the left filter pane on the published dashboard, which can be used for ad hoc (one-time) filtering. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • AvailabilityStatus for ExportToCSVOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. The visual option to export data to .CSV format isn't enabled when this is set to DISABLED. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • VisibilityState for SheetControlsOption - This visibility state can be either COLLAPSED or EXPANDED. This option is COLLAPSED by default.

  • AvailabilityStatus for ExecutiveSummaryOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. The option to build an executive summary is disabled when this is set to DISABLED. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • AvailabilityStatus for DataStoriesSharingOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. The option to share a data story is disabled when this is set to DISABLED. This option is ENABLED by default.

ThemeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme that is being used for this dashboard. If you add a value for this field, it overrides the value that was originally associated with the entity. The theme ARN must exist in the same Amazon Web Services account where you create the dashboard.

Definition.documentation:
The definition of a dashboard.

A definition is the data model of all features in a Dashboard, Template, or Analysis.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: The option to relax the validation needed to update a dashboard with definition objects. This skips the validation step for specific errors.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

VersionArn.documentation: The ARN of the dashboard, including the version number.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard QA configuration that you want to update.

DashboardsQAStatus.documentation: The status of dashboards QA configuration that you want to update.
A value that indicates whether the dashboard QA configuration is enabled or not.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID for the dataset whose permissions you want to update. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

GrantPermissions.documentation: The resource permissions that you want to grant to the dataset.

RevokePermissions.documentation: The resource permissions that you want to revoke from the dataset.

DataSetArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID for the dataset whose permissions you want to update. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID for the dataset that you want to update. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

PhysicalTableMap.documentation: Declares the physical tables that are available in the underlying data sources.

LogicalTableMap.documentation: Configures the combination and transformation of the data from the physical tables.

ImportMode.documentation: Indicates whether you want to import the data into SPICE.

ColumnGroups.documentation: Groupings of columns that work together in certain QuickSight features. Currently, only geospatial hierarchy is supported.

FieldFolders.documentation: The folder that contains fields and nested subfolders for your dataset.

RowLevelPermissionDataSet.documentation: The row-level security configuration for the data you want to create.

RowLevelPermissionTagConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of tags on a dataset to set row-level security. Row-level security tags are currently supported for anonymous embedding only.

ColumnLevelPermissionRules.documentation: A set of one or more definitions of a ColumnLevelPermissionRule .

PerformanceConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for the performance optimization of the dataset that contains a UniqueKey configuration.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID for the dataset that you want to create. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

IngestionArn.documentation: The ARN for the ingestion, which is triggered as a result of dataset creation if the import mode is SPICE.

IngestionId.documentation: The ID of the ingestion, which is triggered as a result of dataset creation if the import mode is SPICE.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

DataSourceId.documentation: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

GrantPermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions that you want to grant on the data source.

RevokePermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions that you want to revoke on the data source.

DataSourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data source.

DataSourceId.documentation: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

DataSourceId.documentation: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

Name.documentation: A display name for the data source.

DataSourceParameters.documentation: The parameters that QuickSight uses to connect to your underlying source.

Credentials.documentation: The credentials that QuickSight that uses to connect to your underlying source. Currently, only credentials based on user name and password are supported.

VpcConnectionProperties.documentation: Use this parameter only when you want QuickSight to use a VPC connection when connecting to your underlying source.

SslProperties.documentation: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) properties that apply when QuickSight connects to your underlying source.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data source.

DataSourceId.documentation: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

UpdateStatus.documentation: The update status of the data source's last update.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the QuickSight account that is connected to the Amazon Q Business application that you want to update.

Namespace.documentation: The QuickSight namespace that contains the linked Amazon Q Business application. If this field is left blank, the default namespace is used. Currently, the default namespace is the only valid value for this parameter.

ApplicationId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Q Business application that you want to update.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains the folder to update.

GrantPermissions.documentation: The permissions that you want to grant on a resource. Namespace ARNs are not supported Principal values for folder permissions.

RevokePermissions.documentation: The permissions that you want to revoke from a resource. Namespace ARNs are not supported Principal values for folder permissions.

Permissions.documentation: Information about the permissions for the folder.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the IAM policy assignment.

AssignmentName.documentation: The name of the assignment, also called a rule. The name must be unique within the Amazon Web Services account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace of the assignment.

AssignmentStatus.documentation:
The status of the assignment. Possible values are as follows:

  • ENABLED - Anything specified in this assignment is used when creating the data source.

  • DISABLED - This assignment isn't used when creating the data source.

  • DRAFT - This assignment is an unfinished draft and isn't used when creating the data source.

PolicyArn.documentation: The ARN for the IAM policy to apply to the QuickSight users and groups specified in this assignment.

Identities.documentation: The QuickSight users, groups, or both that you want to assign the policy to.

Identities.documentation: The QuickSight users, groups, or both that the IAM policy is assigned to.

AssignmentStatus.documentation:
The status of the assignment. Possible values are as follows:

  • ENABLED - Anything specified in this assignment is used when creating the data source.

  • DISABLED - This assignment isn't used when creating the data source.

  • DRAFT - This assignment is an unfinished draft and isn't used when creating the data source.

FailedKeyRegistration.documentation: A list of all customer managed key registrations that failed to update.

SuccessfulKeyRegistration.documentation: A list of all customer managed key registrations that were successfully updated.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with your QuickSight subscription.

PublicSharingEnabled.documentation: A Boolean value that indicates whether public sharing is turned on for an QuickSight account.

PersonalizationMode.documentation: An option to allow QuickSight to customize data stories with user specific metadata, specifically location and job information, in your IAM Identity Center instance.
The personalization mode that is used for the personalization configuration.

QSearchStatus.documentation: The status of the QuickSight Q Search configuration that the user wants to update.
The status of the QuickSight Q Search configuration.

PurchaseMode.documentation:
Determines how SPICE capacity can be purchased. The following options are available.

  • MANUAL: SPICE capacity can only be purchased manually.

  • AUTO_PURCHASE: Extra SPICE capacity is automatically purchased on your behalf as needed. SPICE capacity can also be purchased manually with this option.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the template alias that you're updating.

AliasName.documentation: The alias of the template that you want to update. If you name a specific alias, you update the version that the alias points to. You can specify the latest version of the template by providing the keyword $LATEST in the AliasName parameter. The keyword $PUBLISHED doesn't apply to templates.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the template.

GrantPermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be granted on the template.

RevokePermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be revoked from the template.

TemplateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.

Permissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be set on the template.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the template that you're updating.

SourceEntity.documentation:
The entity that you are using as a source when you update the template. In SourceEntity, you specify the type of object you're using as source: SourceTemplate for a template or SourceAnalysis for an analysis. Both of these require an Amazon Resource Name (ARN). For SourceTemplate, specify the ARN of the source template. For SourceAnalysis, specify the ARN of the source analysis. The SourceTemplate ARN can contain any Amazon Web Services account and any QuickSight-supported Amazon Web Services Region;.

Use the DataSetReferences entity within SourceTemplate or SourceAnalysis to list the replacement datasets for the placeholders listed in the original. The schema in each dataset must match its placeholder.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description of the current template version that is being updated. Every time you call UpdateTemplate, you create a new version of the template. Each version of the template maintains a description of the version in the VersionDescription field.

Definition.documentation:
The definition of a template.

A definition is the data model of all features in a Dashboard, Template, or Analysis.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: The option to relax the validation needed to update a template with definition objects. This skips the validation step for specific errors.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the template.

VersionArn.documentation: The ARN for the template, including the version information of the first version.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the theme alias that you're updating.

AliasName.documentation: The name of the theme alias that you want to update.

ThemeVersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the theme that the alias should reference.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the theme.

GrantPermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be granted for the theme.

RevokePermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be revoked from the theme.

ThemeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme.

Permissions.documentation: The resulting list of resource permissions for the theme.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the theme that you're updating.

BaseThemeId.documentation: The theme ID, defined by Amazon QuickSight, that a custom theme inherits from. All themes initially inherit from a default QuickSight theme.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description of the theme version that you're updating Every time that you call UpdateTheme, you create a new version of the theme. Each version of the theme maintains a description of the version in VersionDescription.

Configuration.documentation: The theme configuration, which contains the theme display properties.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the theme.

VersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the new version of the theme.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the topic that you want to update the permissions for.

TopicId.documentation: The ID of the topic that you want to modify. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

GrantPermissions.documentation: The resource permissions that you want to grant to the topic.

RevokePermissions.documentation: The resource permissions that you want to revoke from the topic.

TopicId.documentation: The ID of the topic that you want to modify. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

TopicArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topic.

Permissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions on the topic.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the topic whose refresh schedule you want to update.

TopicId.documentation: The ID of the topic that you want to modify. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.
The ID of the topic that you want to modify. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

TopicArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topic.

DatasetArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the topic that you want to update.

TopicId.documentation: The ID of the topic that you want to modify. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

Topic.documentation: The definition of the topic that you want to update.

TopicId.documentation: The ID of the topic that you want to modify. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topic.

RefreshArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topic refresh.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

UserName.documentation: The username of the user that you want to update custom permissions for.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the custom permission configuration that you want to update.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that the user belongs to.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation: The name of the custom permissions that you want to update.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

UserName.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight user name that you want to update.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the user is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace. Currently, you should set this to default.

Email.documentation: The email address of the user that you want to update.

Role.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight role of the user. The role can be one of the following default security cohorts:

  • READER: A user who has read-only access to dashboards.

  • AUTHOR: A user who can create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards.

  • ADMIN: A user who is an author, who can also manage Amazon QuickSight settings.

  • READER_PRO: Reader Pro adds Generative BI capabilities to the Reader role. Reader Pros have access to Amazon Q in QuickSight, can build stories with Amazon Q, and can generate executive summaries from dashboards.

  • AUTHOR_PRO: Author Pro adds Generative BI capabilities to the Author role. Author Pros can author dashboards with natural language with Amazon Q, build stories with Amazon Q, create Topics for Q&A, and generate executive summaries from dashboards.

  • ADMIN_PRO: Admin Pros are Author Pros who can also manage Amazon QuickSight administrative settings. Admin Pro users are billed at Author Pro pricing.

The name of the QuickSight role is invisible to the user except for the console screens dealing with permissions.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation:
(Enterprise edition only) The name of the custom permissions profile that you want to assign to this user. Customized permissions allows you to control a user's access by restricting access the following operations:

  • Create and update data sources

  • Create and update datasets

  • Create and update email reports

  • Subscribe to email reports

A set of custom permissions includes any combination of these restrictions. Currently, you need to create the profile names for custom permission sets by using the QuickSight console. Then, you use the RegisterUser API operation to assign the named set of permissions to a QuickSight user.

QuickSight custom permissions are applied through IAM policies. Therefore, they override the permissions typically granted by assigning QuickSight users to one of the default security cohorts in QuickSight (admin, author, reader).

This feature is available only to QuickSight Enterprise edition subscriptions.

UnapplyCustomPermissions.documentation: A flag that you use to indicate that you want to remove all custom permissions from this user. Using this parameter resets the user to the state it was in before a custom permissions profile was applied. This parameter defaults to NULL and it doesn't accept any other value.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderType.documentation:
The type of supported external login provider that provides identity to let a user federate into QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. The type of supported external login provider can be one of the following.

  • COGNITO: Amazon Cognito. The provider URL is cognito-identity.amazonaws.com. When choosing the COGNITO provider type, dont use the "CustomFederationProviderUrl" parameter which is only needed when the external provider is custom.

  • CUSTOM_OIDC: Custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider. When choosing CUSTOM_OIDC type, use the CustomFederationProviderUrl parameter to provide the custom OIDC provider URL.

  • NONE: This clears all the previously saved external login information for a user. Use the DescribeUser API operation to check the external login information.

CustomFederationProviderUrl.documentation: The URL of the custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider that provides identity to let a user federate into QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. This parameter should only be used when ExternalLoginFederationProviderType parameter is set to CUSTOM_OIDC.

ExternalLoginId.documentation: The identity ID for a user in the external login provider.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the account that contains the VPC connection that you want to update.

VPCConnectionId.documentation: The ID of the VPC connection that you're updating. This ID is a unique identifier for each Amazon Web Services Region in an Amazon Web Services account.

Name.documentation: The display name for the VPC connection.

SubnetIds.documentation: A list of subnet IDs for the VPC connection.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: A list of security group IDs for the VPC connection.

DnsResolvers.documentation: A list of IP addresses of DNS resolver endpoints for the VPC connection.

RoleArn.documentation: An IAM role associated with the VPC connection.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC connection.

VPCConnectionId.documentation: The ID of the VPC connection that you are updating. This ID is a unique identifier for each Amazon Web Services Region in anAmazon Web Services account.

UpdateStatus.documentation: The update status of the VPC connection's last update.

AvailabilityStatus.documentation: The availability status of the VPC connection.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

StartFromRow.documentation: A row number to start reading data from.

ContainsHeader.documentation: Whether the file has a header row, or the files each have a header row.

Delimiter.documentation: The delimiter between values in the file.

UploadSettings.documentation: Information about the format for a source file or files.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the user.

UserName.documentation: The user's user name. This value is required if you are registering a user that will be managed in QuickSight. In the output, the value for UserName is N/A when the value for IdentityType is IAM and the corresponding IAM user is deleted.

Role.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight role for the user. The user role can be one of the following:.

  • READER: A user who has read-only access to dashboards.

  • AUTHOR: A user who can create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards.

  • ADMIN: A user who is an author, who can also manage Amazon QuickSight settings.

  • READER_PRO: Reader Pro adds Generative BI capabilities to the Reader role. Reader Pros have access to Amazon Q in QuickSight, can build stories with Amazon Q, and can generate executive summaries from dashboards.

  • AUTHOR_PRO: Author Pro adds Generative BI capabilities to the Author role. Author Pros can author dashboards with natural language with Amazon Q, build stories with Amazon Q, create Topics for Q&A, and generate executive summaries from dashboards.

  • ADMIN_PRO: Admin Pros are Author Pros who can also manage Amazon QuickSight administrative settings. Admin Pro users are billed at Author Pro pricing.

  • RESTRICTED_READER: This role isn't currently available for use.

  • RESTRICTED_AUTHOR: This role isn't currently available for use.

IdentityType.documentation: The type of identity authentication used by the user.

Active.documentation: The active status of user. When you create an Amazon QuickSight user that's not an IAM user or an Active Directory user, that user is inactive until they sign in and provide a password.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation: The custom permissions profile associated with this user.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderType.documentation:
The type of supported external login provider that provides identity to let the user federate into Amazon QuickSight with an associated IAM role. The type can be one of the following.

  • COGNITO: Amazon Cognito. The provider URL is cognito-identity.amazonaws.com.

  • CUSTOM_OIDC: Custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderUrl.documentation: The URL of the external login provider.

ExternalLoginId.documentation: The identity ID for the user in the external login provider.

VPCConnectionId.documentation: The ID of the VPC connection that you're creating. This ID is a unique identifier for each Amazon Web Services Region in an Amazon Web Services account.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC connection.

Name.documentation: The display name for the VPC connection.

VPCId.documentation: The Amazon EC2 VPC ID associated with the VPC connection.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The Amazon EC2 security group IDs associated with the VPC connection.

DnsResolvers.documentation: A list of IP addresses of DNS resolver endpoints for the VPC connection.

AvailabilityStatus.documentation: The availability status of the VPC connection.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role associated with the VPC connection.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the VPC connection was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time that the VPC connection was last updated.

Mode.documentation: The mode of validation for the asset to be created or updated. When you set this value to STRICT, strict validation for every error is enforced. When you set this value to LENIENT, validation is skipped for specific UI errors.

ValidationStrategy.documentation: The option to relax the validation that is required to create and update analyses, dashboards, and templates with definition objects. When you set this value to LENIENT, validation is skipped for specific errors.

PercentRange.documentation: The percent range in the visible range.

VisibleRangeOptions.documentation: The range options for the data zoom scroll bar.

Visual.documentation:
A visual displayed on a sheet in an analysis, dashboard, or template.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

AvailabilityStatus.documentation: The availaiblity status of a visual's axis sort options.

VisualAxisSortOption.documentation: The axis sort options for a visual.

Trigger.documentation:
The trigger of the VisualCustomAction.

Valid values are defined as follows:

  • DATA_POINT_CLICK: Initiates a custom action by a left pointer click on a data point.

  • DATA_POINT_MENU: Initiates a custom action by right pointer click from the menu.

ActionOperations.documentation:
A list of VisualCustomActionOperations.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

VisualCustomAction.documentation: A custom action defined on a visual.

highlightOperation.documentation: A list of highlight operations available for visuals in an analysis or sheet.

VisualCustomActionDefaults.documentation: A list of custom actions applied to visuals in an analysis or sheet.

FilterOperation.documentation: The filter operation that filters data included in a visual or in an entire sheet.

NavigationOperation.documentation: The navigation operation that navigates between different sheets in the same analysis.

URLOperation.documentation: The URL operation that opens a link to another webpage.

SetParametersOperation.documentation: The set parameter operation that sets parameters in custom action.

VisualCustomActionOperation.documentation:
The operation that is defined by the custom action.

This is a union type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be defined.

Trigger.documentation: Specifies whether a highlight operation is initiated by a click or hover, or whether it's disabled.

VisualHighlightOperation.documentation: Defines what initiates a highlight operation on a visual, such as a click or hover.

VisualMenuOption.documentation: The on-visual menu options for a visual.

ContextMenuOption.documentation: The context menu options for a visual.

VisualInteractionOptions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for visual publish options

AvailabilityStatus.documentation: The availaiblity status of a visual's menu options.

ChartColor.documentation: The chart color options for the visual palette.

ColorMap.documentation: The color map options for the visual palette.

VisualPalette.documentation: The visual display options for the visual palette.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the subtitle label.

FormatText.documentation: The long text format of the subtitle label, such as plain text or rich text.

VisualSubtitleLabelOptions.documentation: The subtitle label options for a visual.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the title label.

FormatText.documentation: The short text format of the title label, such as plain text or rich text.

VisualTitleLabelOptions.documentation: The title label options for a visual.

DataLabels.documentation: The data label configuration of a waterfall visual.

VisualPalette.documentation: The visual palette configuration of a waterfall visual.

ColorConfiguration.documentation: The color configuration of a waterfall visual.

Interactions.documentation: The general visual interactions setup for a visual.

NegativeBarColor.documentation: Defines the color for the negative bars of a waterfall chart.

TotalBarColor.documentation: Defines the color for the total bars of a waterfall chart.

WaterfallChartGroupColorConfiguration.documentation: The color configuration for individual groups within a waterfall visual.

TotalBarLabel.documentation: This option determines the total bar label of a waterfall visual.

WaterfallChartOptions.documentation: The options that determine the presentation of a waterfall visual.

CategorySort.documentation: The sort configuration of the category fields.

BreakdownItemsLimit.documentation: The limit on the number of bar groups that are displayed.

WaterfallChartSortConfiguration.documentation: The sort configuration of a waterfall visual.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers.

Title.documentation: The title that is displayed on the visual.

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

ColumnHierarchies.documentation: The column hierarchy that is used during drill-downs and drill-ups.

WaterfallVisual.documentation:
A waterfall chart.

For more information, see Using waterfall charts in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

Date.documentation: The date that you need the forecast results for.

Value.documentation: The target value that you want to meet for the provided date.

WhatIfPointScenario.documentation: Provides the forecast to meet the target for a particular date.

StartDate.documentation: The start date in the date range that you need the forecast results for.

EndDate.documentation: The end date in the date range that you need the forecast results for.

Value.documentation: The target value that you want to meet for the provided date range.

WhatIfRangeScenario.documentation: Provides the forecast to meet the target for a particular date range.

GroupBy.documentation: The group by field well of a word cloud. Values are grouped by group by fields.

Size.documentation: The size field well of a word cloud. Values are aggregated based on group by fields.

CategoryLabelOptions.documentation: The label options (label text, label visibility, and sort icon visibility) for the word cloud category.

The field wells of a word cloud visual.

WordOrientation.documentation: The word orientation options (horizontal, horizontal_and_vertical) for the words in a word cloud.

WordScaling.documentation: The word scaling options (emphasize, normal) for the words in a word cloud.

CloudLayout.documentation: The cloud layout options (fluid, normal) of a word cloud.

VisualId.documentation: The unique identifier of a visual. This identifier must be unique within the context of a dashboard, template, or analysis. Two dashboards, analyses, or templates can have visuals with the same identifiers..

Subtitle.documentation: The subtitle that is displayed on the visual.

Actions.documentation: The list of custom actions that are configured for a visual.

ColumnHierarchies.documentation: The column hierarchy that is used during drill-downs and drill-ups.

A word cloud.

For more information, see Using word clouds in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

YAxis.documentation:
The Y axis type to be used in the chart.

If you choose PRIMARY_Y_AXIS, the primary Y Axis is located on the leftmost vertical axis of the chart.

YAxisOptions.documentation: The options that are available for a single Y axis in a chart.

documentation:
Amazon QuickSight API Reference

Amazon QuickSight is a fully managed, serverless business intelligence service for the Amazon Web Services Cloud that makes it easy to extend data and insights to every user in your organization. This API reference contains documentation for a programming interface that you can use to manage Amazon QuickSight.
